loans.name: Josifina

texts.en:
Josifina M. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay Camiguin. She is 57 years old, and is married with three adult children. To make a living, Josifina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josifina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josifina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josifina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.name: Sérénité Plus Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse Mangwahu 44 ans est dirigeante du groupe dénommé « Sérénité Plus » qui s’est constituée solidairement en vue de recevoir des prêts auprès de Hope Kinshasa RDC. 
Thérèse est entrée dans le monde de micro-entreprise depuis 1996 avec un capital initial de $50. Elle est parvenue à stabiliser son affaire grâce à un travail rigoureux et en réinvestissant les bénéfices accumulés. Son activité se situe dans un quartier périphérique et le plus peuplé au nord de Kinshasa. Elle a reçu trois fois les crédits de Hope qu’elle a remboursé totalement et à temps. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une quincaillerie pour desservir la population de son quartier qui effectue de longues distances pour trouver des pièces qu’elle a besoin. L’appui financier à travers des crédits de Kiva par Hope RDC l’aide à faire prospérer son activité et à réaliser progressivement son rêve. Aujourd’hui, son affaire lui génère hebdomadairement un bénéfice de $30. Elle compte acheter avec le prochain prêt une quantité de clous à revendre en vue d’accroitre le bénéfice. Thérèse est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 1 et 23 ans. Six d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Thérèse Mangwahu, age 44, is the leader of the group named "Sérénité Plus", which was established in solidarity with the aim of receiving loans from HOPE Kinshasa RDC. Thérèse entered the micro-enterprise world in 1996 with $50 in initial capital. She managed to stabilize her business, thanks to rigorous work while reinvesting the accumulated profits. Her business is located in an outlying district and the most populated north of Kinshasa. Thérèse received a loan three times from HOPE, and she totally repaid them and on time. Her ambition is to open a hardware store to serve the people in her district who travel far to find items they need. Financial support through Kiva loans via HOPE RDC is helping her to make her business prosper and, progressively, to realize her dream. Today, her business generates $30 in profit for her weekly. With the next loan, she intends to buy a quantity of nails to resell with the aim of growing her profit. Thérèse is married and the mother of eight children varying in age from 1 to 23. Six of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a quantity of nails to resell in order to increase her profit

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Opportunities have never been scarce for Firuza, who has worked incessantly in diverse trades to support her family. Firuza is a widow and mother of two children. For more than five years, she has worked on the land, cultivating different kinds of crops. She has formed her own businesses depending on the circumstances and the demands of the community.

With her earnings, Firuza has been able to provide food for her children and send them to school. They are now grown and have become productive members of the community. Firuza feels happy that she has completed her work as a mother, although this job truly never ends because she will always be concerned for their wellbeing. What Firuza urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for cultivating her land. Firuza doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

texts.en: A group consists of five members led by Mrs. T., 45, a mother of six children whom all of them are still young and attend school. She is a farmer on a plot of farming land derived from her parents. T. married Pheang, 42, who runs a service of motor repairing in the village since 2000. T. could earn a good income and good living standard with her growing. M., 29, who runs a service of clothes sewing is looking for a loan to buy a more convenient sewing materials. T., 41, a local farmer is asking for a loan to buy a cow for plowing. She is married to Phuk who operates a service of selling ice, and pure water to his neighbors. T. T. earns much more income than expected as she is good at making delicious fried meatballs and toasted sausage, with her special sauce. As they lack transportation, T. and Phuk have decided to request a loan of $ 300 to buy a motorbike that they will use to aid in business transactions. This family has two young children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to aid in selling and operations.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en: K. Mohira is a married woman with four children. She started her business as a result of economic pressure – her husband's salary was not enough to meet their family’s expenses. Mohira began to investigate what work she could do. About ten years ago, one of her friends recommended selling children’s clothing so she decided she'd try that business. Little by little she brought in more clients, which increased her income since her commissions increased as she sold more clothing. Mohira is applying for a loan of 1500 USD to buy merchandise and to fill existing client orders. She hopes that you will collaborate with her. Together with her family, Mohira thanks you for supporting them, and helping the family move ahead. loans.name: Koer

texts.en:
Mrs. T. and her husband have been married for years and have five children, all of whom are single except one who is married and lives away.

With traditional fishing nets, Mrs. T. and her husband, Mathly, spend most of their time during the early morning and late afternoon of the day along the Mekong riverside. Sometimes, Mathly spreads the net into the water using his hands and the power of his shoulders and drags it up a few minutes later. Sometimes, T. rows the boat while he pulls from the water the net which he has prepared for almost half a day.

The family now faces difficulty with its fishing operation. So in order to fix the problem, T. and Mathly decided to look for a loan of $600 to buy an engine and fishing materials for their fishing business.

loans.use: To buy an engine and fishing materials for their fishing business

loans.name: Moussa's Group

texts.fr: Après avoir bénéficié d'un prêt kiva réf 56086 qui nous a permis d'acheter des bovins et ovins que nous avons élevé en les engraissant, nous avons pu les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires situés aux alentours du village de Mboul. Cette fois-ci,  La vente a été bonne. Ce qui nous a permis de payer même avant la date d’échéance du remboursement. Cependant, nous souhaiterions être financés une fois encore pour pouvoir continuer nos activités d’embouche comme c’est notre principal affairement.
texts.en:
Having benefited from a previous Kiva loan (ref 56086) allowing us to buy cattle and sheep that we raised and fattened, we were able to re-sell them at the weekly market fairs located around the village of Mboul. This time, sales were good, which allowed us to repay the loan before the due date. However, we would like to be financed once more to be able to continue our animal-rearing activity, seeing that it is our main business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise and fatten sheep

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka sells gift items in her shop and she has been in the business for the past two years. She is a single young girl, 24 years old, and lives in Lagos.

Amaka has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and her loans have tremendously increased her business and her profitability. Amaka is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more spiritual items and gift items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items and spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Amani North borrower group,In Kinyanambo ,Iringa.she is 23 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 3 and 2 moths years.

Flora started her own salon business 6 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and Eran monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Flora first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Goods for her salon.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Flora hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for salon

loans.name: Sil

texts.en: A great housewife, with good management skills, from the developing country of Cambodia, L. has a family with five children. One of her children is married and lives away while the other four are still living with her. Fortunately, two are employed. One is a garment worker and the other is securitor in a company. This helps the family live more comfortably. L., 43, is married to Hien, 49. Hien works in the commune office as public staff. The family has been able to save from the salaries. Recently, the family decided to upgrade their living standard by purchasing a motorbike. They want their younger children to finish university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Ikweta North,Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 19 years old woman,she is married and  a mother of 3 children.Her children  are aged 15,8 and 22 years.

Lilian started her own Tailoring  business 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly  profit approximately 30,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is lilian`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more material.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Lilian hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina sells provisions, drinks, bread and recharge cards and she has been in the business for the past 4 years. Tina lives in Lagos. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. Tina is grateful to KIVA lenders for their financials support adding that she will increase her business. Tina hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more provisions and recharge cards to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Zoek

texts.en: S., age 20, is married to Piseth, 26. Piseth has run a service as a motor driver for years. S. came from a poor family in a remote area before she met Piseth. Their marriage has given them three children, still very young. This family started to brighten their lives by working in Phnom Penh, Cambodia operating a service with an old motor. After awhile, with their savings, S. and Piseth decide to take a loan of $ 700 to buy a new motorbike for Piseth's driving service. This will allow the family to have a better standard of living amongst the neighbors. S. was not available during the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for Piseth's driving service.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 10 and 4 years.

Rahma started her own Tailoring  business 4 years ago,she worka 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 600,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rahma first loan from BRAC_Tanzania she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rahma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materila

loans.name: Omotosho

texts.en:
Omotosho is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Omotosho sells food items and drinks. 
She has been in this business for the past 6 years. She lives in Lagos. She is requesting for a loan i the amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more food items and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: A garment factory worker, K., 24, is married to Math, 27. Math runs a service as a local construction provider. K. has two children who are still young and attend school. In addition to their savings, K. and Math are looking for a loan of $ 500 to buy wooden poles and supplies to renovate their house. Koryass was not available during the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy wooden poles and walls to renovate their house.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: There is a house where neighbors always cross by with a more joyful interaction with a good communication. There is a household grocery store, run by a strong housewife with a good relationship. P., 34, has three children, all of whom are still young. P. is married to Ly, 46, who employed as a local construction service provider in the village. The family has now gained much better income as this couple has a careful plan for its family. This year, P. and Ly are preparing to buy a new small plot of land located next to her house. This is why they have agreed to ask for a loan of $ 600. The couple really wants their children to finish university in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new small plot of land located next to their house.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Morogoro,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 19 and 10 years.

Rebeca started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 5 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Rebeca`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Rebeca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is 35 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Iyabo sells yams and she has been in this business for the past fifteen years. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
In a crowd of people walking back and forth from one person to another in the market, in particular the place selling food such as fried meatballs, toasted sausage, and toasted meat – M. is one of the sellers and has run that kind of business for years.

Her husband, Pov, 39, works as a photographer and sometimes as a motor-driver in the city. Their marriage gave them four children, all of whom are still young and attend school.

With great deliberation, M. and Pov decide to take a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike to upgrade their living standard. They want all their children to finish university.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to upgrade their living standard

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she separated from her husband and she also a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 27,23,20,15 and 10 years. 

Zainabu started her own clothing business selling vitenge,kanga(fabric) 20 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zainabu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of  400,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge and kanga.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Zainabu hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S., 39, and her husband, 36, support their family by fishing with nets along the Mekong river. They always wake up at dawn every day to gather the fish from their nets which they put in the water the night before. After that they re-set the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon.

After gathering the fishes from the river, S. hurries to the market so that she can sell at a suitable price. Recently, S. and Soe decided to take out a loan of $400 to buy an engine for their fishing boat.

They have four children all of whom are still young and attend school.

loans.use: To buy a motor for their boat

loans.name: Kenyi

texts.en:
Kenyi R. currently sells bedsheets and dresses and requests for a loan to purchase a sewing machine.  She is 45 years old and married.  Kenyi has five children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more sewing machines sewing dresses, pairs of trousers, pairs of shorts etc.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Ajelina is a member of the Bwawani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 48 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 13 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Ajelina started her own clothing business selling clothes 8 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Ajelina`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 In order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan AJelina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Oren

texts.en:
Oren K. is a 28-year-old single gentleman. He lives in Kinoo which is a suburban area.

Oren was introduced to KADET by his friends who were already in KADET. His main business is selling clothes and shoes. He hawks them (goes door-to-door) to his neighbors and the surrounding community and he also distributes newspapers to specific customers on the side. Oren has applied for a Kshs. 60,000 loan which he plans to use in restocking his clothes and shoes business.

Oren hopes and plans to eventually have a shop instead of hawking his goods. This will enable him to be more settled and establish a good relationship with his customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Francis Gitau

texts.en:
Francis K. is a 24-year-old businessman who has been in the beauty products business for the past five years. His business is located within Eldoret Town along Oloo street. His major customers are Eldoret residents who include working ladies and college-going students.

Francis was introduced to KADET by a colleague who was already a member. With the loan he is taking from KADET, Francis intends to add more stock to his beauty shop which includes chemicals, earrings and necklaces.

In future he intends to expand to other towns and also to open up a salon in the town. He believes that life is beautiful and thus all else should be beautiful.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products including earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne K. is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in the interior part of Uthiru where there is less competition; hence her business has an opportunity to grow. She has been running her tailoring shop for a number of years now.

Anne was introduced to KADET by her friend who is the Chairlady of her current group. Anne has never borrowed from another financial institution before and this will be her third loan with KADET. She paid off her previous loans very well without any difficulty.
 
Anne’s customers are mostly the neighbors around her and, besides tailoring, she makes other goods like seat covers and supplies to other traders. She wants to buy more materials for her business so as to have a variety for her clients to choose from.

Anne desires to buy more sewing machines and especially an embroidery machine so that she can diversify her skills and products.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy M. Z. tiene 20 años y concubina con el señor Maximo Hidalgo Sanchez por 5 años. Tienen 1 hijo de 6 años que asiste a una escuela de la zona.  La señora Nancy vive en el pueblo de Tiraque en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 maquinas para la confección de ropa, con las cuales confecciona ropa femenina Polleras (La polllera es una vestimenta femenina tradicional de Bolivia). La señora Nancy después de fallecer sus padres y quedar huérfana a la edad de 12 años comenzó como ayudante de una costurera de Polleras y luego de poder ahorrar lo suficiente se compro las maquinas para poder confeccionar polleras ella sola. 

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de material para la confección de prendas de vestir(Tela y Rollos) por que la demanda de su producto subió considerablemente en el último año por ser de muy buena calidad. Su deseo es poder seguir incrementando el número de polleras vendidas para poder ahorra y en un futuro comprar un terreno y construir una casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy M. Z. is 20 years old and lives with Mr. Maximo Hidalgo Sanchez. They have lived together for 5 years and have a six year-old son who attends a local school. Mrs. Nancy lives in the town of Tiraque in Cochabamba. She has three sewing machines, which she uses to make “Polleras”, the traditional skirt in Bolivia. After her parents died and she became an orphan at age 12, Mrs. Nancy started to work as an assistant seamstress of Polleras. She was able to save enough money to buy her own sewing machines to make the Polleras by herself.

This loan will be used to purchase sewing material (fabric and spools) to be able to meet the increasing demand for her high quality products. Her wish is to continue to increase the number of Polleras sold, and save enough money to buy land and build a house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing material to make traditional skirts (Polleras )

loans.name: Rashidat

texts.en:
Rashidat is 53 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she has sold tailoring materials for over thirty years.

Rashidat has been with LAPO Micro-finance for eight months. She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to expand her business and purchase more tailoring materials to enable her to meet her customers’ needs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Massama-Esso

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur s’est spécialisé depuis 2002 à Lomé dans le commerce du charbon de bois. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Ce commerce qu’il exerce dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Parce que son stock fini, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 09 grands sacs de charbon, 11 sacs moyens et 12 petits sacs. Cet homme est expérimenté et a un nombre élevé de clients.
texts.en:
Since 2002, this gentleman has specialized in the sale of charcoal in Lomé. He is married and has one child. This business, which he runs at the market in Agoè Assiyéyé, allows him to provide for his family. Because his stock is depleted, he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 9 large bags of charcoal, 11 medium-sized bags, and 12 small bags. This man is experienced and has a large number of customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Agoè Atsanvé à Lomé et a ouvert depuis 2003 dans sa maison une boutique de produits alimentaires  et congelés qui alimente tout le quartier et ses environs. Elle est mariée et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses 02 enfants. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, des produits congelés, des pâtes alimentaires et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Agoé Atsanvé area of Lomé and, in 2003, she opened a store in her house selling food and frozen products that feed the entire area and its surroundings. She is married, and this business allows her to provide for her 2 children. To replenish her stock, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 3 cans of oil, 5 bags of rice, frozen products, food pastes, and various other products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans le commerce de pagnes et de produits génériques dans son quartier à Agoè Bafana à Lomé ; elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et a une clientèle qui lui est propre, car vendant des pagnes de très bonne qualité et des produits génériques. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle demande un prêt de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en 15 lots de 6 pagnes Hitarget, 18 lots de 6 pagnes Phoenix, 14 lots de 6 pagnes Real Wax et des boîtes de produits génériques.
texts.en:
This woman specializes in selling pagnes (a type of brightly printed cloth) and other generic products in her district, Agoè Bafana, in Lomé; she is married and has one child. She has run this business since 2004 and has a decent clientele, because she sells pagnes of very high quality and other products. To replenish her stock, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to supply herself with 15 sets of 6 Hitarget-type pagnes, 18 sets of 6 Phoenix-type pagnes, 14 sets of Real Wax-type pagnes, and boxes of generic products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy high quality pagnes (a type of printed cloth)

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 44years old, married with 3 children; she lives in Lagos State Nigeria. She sells ladies shoes, bags, jewelries and clothes. She has been in this business for over 23years. She has been with LAPO Micro finance for a year. Titilayo is requesting for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more ladies shoes, bags and Jewelries also to expand her business to enable her meet her customer’s needs. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, jewelries,ladies shoes and bags

loans.name: Miel Plus Group

texts.fr:
Gaby K. 42 ans, est présidente d’un groupe d’emprunteurs constitué de 27 membres dénommé « Miel Plus » qui signifie « Honey » en anglais. 
Elle gère son propre restaurant depuis 2006 et elle a intégré cette Banque Communautaire « Miel Plus » depuis novembre 2008. Gaby a acquit une expérience solide dans la gestion de son restaurant qui se situe au nord-est de Kinshasa. Elle et son groupe ont déjà reçu une fois les crédits de Kiva à travers l’Institution de Micro finance Hope RDC et ils les ont remboursés correctement. Elle compte acheter avec le prochain prêt, des poissons et poulets pour renforcer le stock de son restaurant en vue de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients qui ne cessent de croitre et augmenter le bénéfice. A coté de l’ambition d’étendre son activité en y ajoutant une terrasse, Gaby rêve aussi à construire un jour une maison pour sa famille. Elle et son groupe sont déterminés à développer leurs affaires avec l’appui financier de Kiva à travers des crédits reçus de l’IMF Hope RDC. Gaby est mariée et mère de cinq enfants âgés entre 4 et 16 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Gaby K., 42 years old, is the president of a group of borrowers, comprising 27 members, named "Miel Plus," which means "Honey" in English. She has been running her own restaurant since 2006, and has been a part of this Community Bank, "Miel Plus," since November 2008. Gaby has gained solid experience in the management of her restaurant, which is located in the northwest part of Kinshasa. She and her group have already received one set of loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution Hope RDC (one of Kiva's field partners), which they repaid without incident. With this next loan, she intends to buy fish and chickens to increase her restaurant's supply, with the goal of satisfying the needs of her constantly increasing clientele and increasing her profits. In addition to her ambition of extending her business by adding an outdoor seating area, Gaby also dreams one day of building a house for her family. She and her group are determined to develop their businesses with the financial support of Kiva through the loans they obtain from Hope RDC. Gaby is married and and has five children, aged between 4 and 16. All of them go to school.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and chickens to increase the restaurant's supply

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gnakoudalo

texts.fr: Cette dame est veuve et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle vend depuis 1998 dans le marché d’Assiyéyé à Lomé des friperies. Elle livre aussi ces vêtements à des clients à domicile. Pour nenouveler son stock qui épuise, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 06 bals de vêtements de toute sorte. Elle a une clientèle qui lui est fidèle.

loans.use: Achat des bals de friperie

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 51years old and married with 4 children. She lives at Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for over 3years. She has been with LAPO Micro finance for a year. Grace hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Marianita De Jesus

texts.es:
Marianita vive en Quinta Chica, C. las Chorreras, en la ciudad de Cuenca;  tiene 44 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 23, 22, años de edad  fruto de su unión matrimonial, todos son solteros, trabajan y estudian, tiene casa propia y su marido es un gran apoyo en el hogar.

Es costurera  trabaja elaborando delantales, pero también se dedica al comercio de productos para la belleza de la mujer como son los cosméticos  de Yanbal, es vendedora ambulante y recorre todos los mercados de la ciudad o donde se encuentran las ferias, su horario de trabajo es todos los días  de 8 a.m. a 12 p.m.

Cuando están buenas las ventas agradece a Dios por el buen día de trabajo y cuando están malas la ventas se resigna a no llevar todos los alimentos a casa.

Marianita es un miembro del Banco Comunal Las Estrellitas lo conforman un grupo de 11 socias, que se dedican al comercio, ellas viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca como son muy buenas amigas todas decidieron formar responsablemente el Banco Comunal, se llevan muy bien  entre todos y se respaldan mutuamente, porque desean el bienestar de todas ellas y la superación de cada una.

Marianita para fabricar sus delantales compra la materia prima como es tela, corosiles, hilo etc. y trabaja en un taller pequeño en su casa, el préstamo que realiza es para comprar material para su negocio y la compra de una maquina overlock, que le hace mucha falta, también desea ampliar el surtido de productos femeninos como son los cosméticos para sus clientas.

Su sueño es llegar a tener una fábrica para ser una productora y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marianita lives in Quinta Chica on Chorreras street in the city of Cuenca. She is 44 and married. She and her husband have three children, ages 25, 23, and 22. All of the children are single, work, and go to school. She has her own house, and her husband is a big help at home. She is a seamstress, and she makes aprons. She also sells women’s beauty products like Yanbal cosmetics. Her sales are ambulatory. She goes to all of the markets in the city or where there are fairs. Her work schedule is from 8 a.m. until 12 p.m. every day. When sales are good she thanks God for the good work day. When sales are bad she is resigned to not bringing all of the food home. Marianita is a member of the Las Estrellitas Community bank is made up of 11 members who devote themselves to commerce. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. As they are all good friends, they decided to responsibly form the community bank. They get along very well with each other, and they support each other. They wish for the well being of all of them, and they hope that each one excels. To make her aprons Marianita buys raw material like fabric, synthetic leather, and thread, etc. She works in a small shop in her house. The loan is to buy material for her business and to buy an Overlock machine, which she really needs. She also wishes to expand her stock of feminine products like cosmetics for her customers. Her dream is to have a factory in order to be a producer and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material like thread, fabric, etc., an Overlock machine, and more Yanbal products for her customers

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos O. G. es socio del Banco Comunal Las Estrellitas, un grupo de 11 socias (casi todas mujeres) que se dedican al comercio. Ellas viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca como son muy buenas amigas todas decidieron formar responsablemente el Banco Comunal, se llevan muy bien entre todas y se respaldan mutuamente, porque desean el bienestar de todas ellas y la superación de cada una.

Roberto vive en el sector la Gloria, en las calles Ave. Loja y Pichincha, en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 37 años de edad, está felizmente casado y tiene una buena relación con su cónyuge, fruto de su amor procreo  5 hijos de 13, 11, 6, 3, 1 año de edad, su primera hija y el segundo  estan en el colegio Garaicoa, el tercero a la escuela 3 de Noviembre, no viven en casa propia. 

Trabaja como vendedor ambulante de mercadería de acuerdo a la temporada (toda la ropa que se encuentre a la moda), su horario es de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. de lunes a sábado, le encanta su trabajo y no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en el.

Nos cuenta que lo bueno de ser negociante es ser dueño de su propio tiempo por lo que comparte con los seres que más ama, se lleva muy bien con todos los socios de mi bankito, es su segundo ciclo trabajando junto a la FUNADACION ESPOIR y se siente muy contento y agradecido por las facilidades que le conceden.

El préstamo que realiza lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería surtida, porque  realizará viajes a Quito, Latacunga, Guayaquil y otras ciudades del país para traer más y mejor mercadería y, de esta manera abastecer con suficiente stock su negocio para los último meses del año.

Su sueño para el futuro es darles todos los estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a ser  profesionales  y tratar de reunir un dinero para su vejez.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos O. G. is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas”, a group composed of 11 members (mostly women) who engage in their own businesses. They live in different areas within the city of Cuenca. The members are all very good friends who decided to get together to form a responsible Communal Bank. They get along well and are supportive of one another because they are concerned about the well-being of the group and helping each other overcome obstacles.

Roberto lives in the area of La Gloria, which is near the streets of Ave. Loja and Pichincha in the city of Cuenca. He is 37 years old, happily married, and has a good relationship with his wife. They produced 5 children (ages 13, 11, 6, 3, and 1). The oldest two children attend Garaicoa School, while the third child attends the “November 3” School. They do not own their home.

Roberto is a door-to-door salesman who offers seasonal merchandise (all clothing that is in fashion). His work schedule is from 8am to 5pm, Monday through Saturday. He enjoys his job and does not experience any difficulties with it.

He tells us that the best thing about being a businessman is managing his schedule so that he can spend time with the people he loves the most. He gets along well with the other members of Mi Bankito, who are starting their second loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR. They are very happy and grateful for the services provided to them.

Roberto will use his loan to purchase merchandise on his trips to Quito, Latacunga, Guayaquil, other cities around the country. He will bring back more merchandise of better quality, which should give him sufficient inventory to last his business until the end of the year.

He dreams of providing for his children’s future education so that they can become professionals and of saving enough money for retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase enough merchandise to last until the end of the year

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 60 años de edad, es agricultor y vive con su esposa, su hijo y sus nietos en el sector Sialupe Baca, ubicado cerca al distrito de Mórrope, a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la gricultura y depende de ella para sostener a su familia, posee un terreno de una hectárea que trabaja junto a su hijo y  durante esta campaña han sembrado frijol pallar.

Emilio y su hijo se esfuerzan día a día por cuidar su sembrío para tener una buena cosecha; actualmente el frijol ya tiene dos meses de haberse sembrado y ellos están solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de abono y foliares.

Su gran anhelo es poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y obtener ganancias que le permitan seguir sembrando en su parcela; asi también poder darle a sus nietos los estudios que necesitan para progresar en el futuro.

Emilio ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución y anteriormente se le ha atendido con tres créditos ,demostrando ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Emilio is a 60 year old farmer. He lives with his wife, son, and grandchildren in the Sialupe Baca region, located near the district of Mórrope which is 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has devoted almost his entire life to agriculture and depends on it to support his family. He possesses one hectare of land on which he and his son grow their crops. For this season, they have planted lima beans.

Emilio and his son tend to their crops on a daily basis to ensure a good harvest. The beans were planted two months ago and now he is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from our Institution to buy fertilizers and plant nutrients.

Emilio desires to give his family a better quality of life and generate enough income that will allow him to continue cultivating his plot of land. He would also like to provide for his grandchildren’s education so that they will have a better future.

Emilio has already worked with our Institution and received three previous loans. He has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilzers and plant nutrients to maintain his crop of lima beans

loans.name: Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
Diversos son los negocios de las integrantes del grupo “Torre Fuerte” que pertenece al Centro Focal “Los Andes”, como la venta de comida, combustibles, pan, golosinas,  muebles,  pasteles, zapatos, ropa y cosméticos y todas necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo o comprar herramientas. Este grupo nació hace aproximadamente 6 años la señora  Eulogia S. cuenta que su cuñada la invitó a ser parte del grupo y ella aceptó porque necesitaba dinero para incrementar su capital de trabajo, Eulogia vende dulces en la calle  "Eloy Salmon" de la ciudad de La Paz, ahora necesita el préstamo para seguir incrementando su mercadería, comprando golosinas de marca. 

Este grupo cuenta con doce integrantes, trabajan muy unidas con el apoyo de su Asesora de Créditos, además les gusta capacitarse  y hacer uso del consultorio.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Set Net Point Group

texts.es:
La  señora Linda Rachell H.W.es la responsable de 11 personas de la comunidad de Set net Point las cuales están siendo beneficiadas con materiales eléctricos para poder tener luz eléctrica en sus viviendas, ya que en esta comunidad, no existe este servicio. La comunidad de Set Net Point esta ubicada al norte de la ciudad de Bluefields a unas tres horas en panga con motor fuera de borda vía marítima e históricamente no han tenido acceso a este servicio, Por tal razón ADEPHCA-KIVA y Blue Energy están buscando financiamiento a través de los créditos de Kiva materiales eléctricos que consisten en lo siguiente: 
Una cuchilla con 2 fusibles que cuesta US 12 cada una, un controlador de carga focos cuesta US 35 cada una, una lámpara de 11 Wats cuesta US 10 cada una , un cepo de bujía cuesta US1 cada uno, un interruptor cuesta US1 cada uno y alambre eléctrico numero 14 que cuesta US 51 dólar por los 11 beneficiarios. 
Se espera con este financiamiento que les permita a los beneficiarios poder aprovechar la luz eléctrica para mejorar su nivel de vida y aprovechar parte de la noche en sus quehaceres diarios, En la foto no aparece el señor Kardell T. López ya que se encontraba realizando faenas de pesca.
Cabe mencionar que se acaba de financiar por parte de Kiva a otro grupo de la comunidad de Monkey Point, los cuales ya están en repago sus créditos y ya cuentan con luz eléctrica.
texts.en:
Sra. Linda Rachell H.W.is responsible for 11 people in the community of Set Net Point who have joined together to receive electricity for their homes because this service is not provided in the area. The community of Set Net Point is located north of the city of Bluefields and is 3 hours away by motorboat. This area historically has not had access to electricity service. ADEPHCA has partnered with Blue Energy to seek funding through Kiva to purchase the following electrical materials:

• blades with 2 fuses that costs $12 USD each • charge controllers that costs $35 USD each • 11 Watt lamps that costs $10 USD each • light bulb clamps that cost $1 USD each • light switches that cost $1 USD each • #14 electrical wiring that costs $51 USD for 11 beneficiaries

It is hoped that this funding will allow these families to take advantage of electricity service so that they can improve their standard of living and perform their household chores at night. Sr. Kardell T. López does not appear in the photo because he was away at his job as a fisherman.

It is worth mentioning that Kiva funding was used to finance another group in the community of Monkey Point. They are already repaying their loans and now have electricity.

Click HERE to view the group loan for the Monkey Point community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment & supplies needed to receive electricity

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Hardwork, dedication and prayer are three elements that 39-year-old Mrs. Miraluna S. of Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, believes can make her life easier. Mrs. S. and her husband, Mr. Clemente S., work hard together to support their four children.

Mrs. S. started her sari-sari (general) store soon after she joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was determined to help her husband earn additional income for the family. But Mrs. S. didn't stop at her sari-sari store. She continued to look for other investment opportunities and sources of income, and she decided to try the fishing business.

Using the loan she got from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she bought a motorized boat and fish nets, and started her fishing venture which, over time, proved to be a lucrative source of income for her and her family. For her 22nd loan cycle she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she plans to use partly to buy additional fishing equipment and the other part as additional capital for her sari-sari store. Part of the income from these ventures she hopes to save for her children's education.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and for use as capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera, tiene 25 años de edad y vive con sus padres en el distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio de venta de animales que ella misma cría (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), este negocio le brinda los recursos necesarios para sostener a sus padres los acuales son de avanzada edad.

Su negocio ha ido prosperando y ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de ovejas, pero lo que percibe en ganancias no le basta para alimentarlas, por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1200 soles que invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales.

Su deseo es que el negocio siga creciendo y hacer una pequeña granja que le brinde a ella y a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una joven educada y responsable.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the district of Mórrope, located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small home business selling animals that she raises herself (such as sheep, pigs, and chickens). This business provides her the necessary income to support her elderly parents.

Business has been thriving because she has many sheep, but her revenues are not enough to feed them. This is the first time Rosa has applied for a loan from our Institution. She is requesting 1200 soles to purchase feed for her animals.

She hopes that her business continues to grow and plans to convert it into a small farm so that she can achieve a better quality of life for herself and her family. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be an educated and responsible young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group 2, 3, 7

texts.en:
Vonice J. is a successful microentrepreneur and president of the Bank of Hope: Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women) who has spent the last 10 years plying her trade in the Area known as Villa Asención surrounding the port city of Puerto Plata in the Domincian Republic. This area rarely has electricity (only a few hours a day) and is located close to a river where water is drawn. She is married and lives with her Husband as well as her three children aged 3, 6 and 9 in a rented house.

Vonice plans to use this loan as opportunity to continue expanding her business which will lead to higher income and give her the ability to improve her housing situation by purchasing her own home. Vonice says that she is grateful for having had the opprtunity to work with Esperanza because it has improved her life and Esperanza is happy to have her as she is a good associate with a solid repayment record over the last two loan cycles.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita Y. is 46 years old, married to Mr. Nemuel Y., and blessed with one child. She is united with her husband in their common goal of improving their standard of living.

Mrs. Y. already helped her husband in their buy and sell business, but she wanted to set up her own business to earn more for the family. She joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, to have access to the capital she needed to set up a sari-sari (general) store adjacent to their house. Later, she diversified into fishing. From these business activities, she earns 8,000 PHP per month.

Mrs. Y. is on her twelfth loan cycle and is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She will use this loan to purchase an additional pump or motorized boat for her fishing business and as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

The picture here shows Mrs. Nenita Y. with her husband, Nemuel, inside her sari-sari store.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As capital for her sari-sari store and to purchase pump for fishing business

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: L. Aisha is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children aged 18 – 3 years as she takes care of her old parents and 3 orphans. She is a tailor and at the same time is involved into the sale of cloth materials for 10 years and her major challenge is the limited capital she has hence not having enough stock all the time. At the moment, she makes 80,000/= as weekly profits due to her quality materials and the fashionable designs for her customers. Her goal is to own business premises so as to stop renting plus own a house and improve the quality of life of her family. Aisha needs a loan to help increase cloth stock for the profits derived out of the business will help to meet the ever growing demand for the clothes that she sells hence more income.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for sale and for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Mrs. Emma D., 53 years old, is married to Cirilo D. and blessed with 6 adult children. She lives in Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. All of her children work to help improve their standard of living.

Mrs. D. has owned and operated a "sari-sari" or general store for the past 8 years and earns Php 3,500 per month that contributes a lot to the living expenses of her family.

The 8th loan amounting to Php 15,000 that Mrs. Emma D. is borrowing will be utilized as additional capital for her "sari-sari" or general store, and some will be used for house improvements. The attached picture shows Mrs. D. with her husband.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For her sari-sari store and house improvements

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
B. Edward is the leader of his group in Jinja. He is a responsible and hard -working married man with 6 children aged 16 – 4 years and all in school as he cares for 4 orphans belonging to his late brothers and sisters. His business is buying timber and transporting it from deep in the villages and this alone is a challenge that he is living with. He has had the business for 7 years and at the moment makes some good profit that enables him to pay his children’s school fees and general upkeep.

Edward’s goal is to increase his stock of timber so that he can make more profit out of it to be able to educate all his children to university level. He needs a loan to help him buy more timber for resale. Also in the photo is Richard, the Officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: Buying more timber for resale

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Mrs. Rona M., 34 years old, married with 1 child and coming from Prk Malipayon, Brgy. Atipuluhan, Bago City, Negros Occidental says that she is very lucky, thankful and proud that she has been part of NWTF-Project Dungganon for over 9 years because it has contributed a lot to improving her standard of living.

Mrs. M. is engaged in running a general store, specifically selling rice products in her local community and nearest town. Her 9th loan amounting to Php 29,500 will be utilized in expanding her business. From this business she earns Php 10,000 per month and it helps a lot in covering the needs of immediate members of her family. She has learned a lot from NWTF-Project Dungganon on how to manage and develop her business which has ultimately improved the life of her family.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
I. Paul is 28 years old and the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with three children aged 6, 4, and 2 years and he helps to cater for his sister who is in school. He is a businessman dealing in the sale of clothes, maize, and beans from Namulesa; for 8 years he has been dealing in all the businesses.

The main challenge that Paul faces,especially with his clothes business, is that some customers take the goods on credit and fail to pay hence having a bad effect on his cash flow. On average, Paul makes 90,000/= as weekly profits and one of his strong points is that he is a trustworthy person with a strong drive to invest more into his businesses.

Paul hopes to construct a house for his family so that they can stop renting. He needs a loan to help buy 20 more bags of maize for resale since this will help expand his stock in that business. Paul is also a friendly and determined person.

loans.use: Buying more bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Villa Asención Group 6

texts.en:
Jaquelin P. is the group coordinator of Villa Asencion Group 6 and has been a valued associate of the Esperanza organization for over 5 loan cycles. She has over six years of experience in her business of selling clothing shoes and cosmetic products. Jaquelin lives in the Villa Asencion neighborhood outside of Puerto Plata with her three children and her husband. In this neighborhood electricity comes only several hours a week and water is gathered from the river.

Jaquelin intends to use this loan to buy more working capital for her business. Specifically she will purchase 5 pairs of pants, 12 pairs of shoes and $55 worth of cosmetics. This she believes will help her continue to grow her business in the future and improve the lives of herself and her children. Something which she feels working with Esperanza has helped her do in the past and that she expects will continue in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing, shoes and creams to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
N. Joyce is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 41 years old and a mother of 4 children aged 16 – 9 and she cares for orphans, too.

Joyce has had a retail shop in Kigaya village for 15 years now and she is happy that at the moment, she is able to make a weekly profit of 80,000/=. When she just started doing her business, she had no enclosed setting but only sold from a patch of shade outside her small house, but now she has a shop and this brings excitement to her life.

She says that the loans have helped her very much in her business plus the good customer care, and she has a hope of someday owning a wholesale shop and educating all her children to the University. She needs to restock her shop with more products so as to earn more profits to pay her children’s school fees. The photo was captured in a motion form but all members belong to Zibula Atudde group.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married with three children. She has got a small cafe located at the central market in Vinogradovo city. She used to sell small home products at the same market. Because of high competition she decided to change her business and began to make food and sell it to the market vendors. This happened about two years ago. Natalia's income increased and became more stable.

Natalia would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase additional equipment for her cafe. This would allow her to increase the assortment and produce more food for sale.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai S. (0) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Faleula Fogaa. She is married and has six adult children.

Fenumiai owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 650 WST a month.

Fenumiai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,400 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Fenumiai is now requesting a new loan of 5,150 WST which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 30 años, vive con sus 2 hijos; Diego de 17 y Carlos de 13 años de edad, ya que su esposo falleció hace algunos años, ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde muy joven ha trabajado duro para brindarle bienestar a su familia, pero desde que se quedó sola se dedicó con mucha más fuerza a su negocio. Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio, negocio gracias al cual puede tener cierta tranquilidad económica, además con los constantes microcréditos que ha tenido a lo largo de todos estos años, logró comprar un motocarro, con el que trabaja su hijo mayor desde que terminó la secundaria, pues no encontraba trabajo y optó por ayudarlo de esa manera. Ahora él trabaja durante todo el día brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros y también puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Lo que empezó como una pequeña tienda se está convirtiendo en una gran fuente de ingresos económicos para la familia, pues Delia implementa constantemente novedades a su negocio, y ahora compró fruta y vegetales, con lo cual su tienda está siendo cada vez más concurrida. Este es el tercer préstamo de Delia de manera individual con MFP, todos los créditos anteriores que ha tendido la han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is 30 years old and lives with her 2 sons, Diego and Carlos (ages 17 and 14 respectively). She and her family live in their own home. Her husband died some years ago. Since she was younger, Delia has worked hard to provide for the welfare of her family. Now that she is a widow, she has invested a lot more effort into her business. She operates a grocery store out of her home. Thanks to her business, she experiences financial security and peace of mind. By taking advantage of microloans throughout the years, Delia was able to buy a motorcar and provide a work for her eldest son. He graduated from high school, but was not able to find a job, so he chose to help his mother in this capacity. He now provides transportation services to passengers and is able to help with the household expenses.

What started out as a small shop has become a major source of income for her family. Delia constantly introduces new products to her business, and as a result, her store is becoming increasingly crowded. She now wants to purchase fruits and vegetables.

Delia is requesting her third loan from MFP. All of her previous loans have helped improve her quality of life and that of her family. She will use the money to purchase more merchandise to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Iloa

texts.en: Iloa T. (0) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Vavau. She is married and has five school-aged children. Iloa owns and operates a business running a bakery, baking and selling cookies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month. In 2001, Iloa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Iloa is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase baking equipment. The loan will be her 6th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo Osvaldo y sus 2 hijos: Edwin de 23 y Marlon de 12 años de edad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de alimentos en la pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa para poder solventar los gastos de su familia. Pues este negocio resultó mucho más cómodo y eficaz, ya que paralelamente puede realizar las labores de su hogar; felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos para atender la tienda en su ausencia. Abastecerse de nueva mercadería es lo que le resulta cansado, pues es muy complicado llegar desde el mercado hasta la zona donde vive. Erlinda quiere crecer y ser la tienda más concurrida de su barrio para obtener más ganancias, con las cuales pueda construir su casa de material noble y trasladar su tienda a un espacio más adecuado donde ordene sus productos y tengan una mejor vista para la clientela, ofreciéndoles comodidad y variedad. Este es el tercer préstamo individual de Erlinda con MFP, siendo siempre muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mercadería para abastecer su tienda de mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
"Pele F. (0) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Sataoa.  She is married and has 3 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Pele operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Pele has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately $650 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Pele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Pele is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Pele is now requesting a new loan of $1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Pele plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: 8 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Villa Adela se reúne la asociación “8 De Marzo” , actualmente está formada por catorce mujeres, ellas han demostrado responsabilidad en las actividades internas del grupo, es así que cumplen once años de trabajo junto a Pro Mujer.
Su presidenta es Gaby Z., cuenta que el grupo se formo entre familiares y amigas, dada la necesidad de buscar fuentes de ingreso para poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos.
Dentro el grupo existen diferentes negocios, Milenka por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de cosméticos; otras de ellas venden productos desechables (bosas, vasos, platos etc.);venta de  ropa  y accesorios para  bebes; venta de calzados por catalogo, entre otros.
La asociación 8 De Marzo necesita comprar mercadería, de este modo mejorar sus ganancias y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
The "8 De Marzo" group, comprised of fourteen women, meets in the center of Villa Adela. They have demonstrated their responsibility in the group's internal activities, which is how they have been around for eleven years working together with Pro Mujer. Gaby Z., the group's president, tells that the group was formed among friends and family members faced with the need to find sources of income to fund their children's schooling. Within the group there are different businesses. Milkenka, for example, sells cosmetics, others sell different disposable products (bags, glasses, plates, etc.), clothing and accessories for babies, and catalog order shoe sales among others. The "8 De Marzo" group needs to buy merchandise in order to increase their earnings and family incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying of Merchandise

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina A. F. (0) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitele K Fou. She is married and has twelve adult children. Selina owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling ice cream in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 300 WST a month. Selina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosas Rojas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Rosas Rojas está ubicado en la Estancia, Parroquia el Cabo, en el Cantón Paute,  Paute es una zona turística de la provincia del Azuay, es visitado por su clima tropical, las plantaciones de flores y la gran variedad de frutas que se cultivan en sus tierras. 

El Banco Comunal está conformado por 14 socias todas muy amables y alegres se llevan muy entre sí y son muy buenas vecinas en su comunidad, se dedican a diferentes labores ya sea en la casa o fuera de ellas, es así por ejemplo citamos unas de ellas:

Gloria vive en la Estancia es una comunidad minutos antes de llegar a Paute, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada vive con su esposo y se llevan muy bien en su vida matrimonial, fruto de su unión conyugal concibieron 3 hijos de 10, 9, 8 años de edad, todos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres en cuartos separados, su esposo trabaja como chofer y es un pilar fundamental en su hogar.

Gloria es comerciante de ropa y tiene puesto propio en el mercado San José de Paute y también vende en su casa, trabaja en su negocio hace 4 años, y su horario es de 9 a.m. a 5 p.m. de lunes a domingo y en su casa a tiende en la noche o a la hora que lleguen a comprar por que tiene una gran variedad de ropa para hombre, mujer y niño todo muy surtido.

Es su segundo crédito y le a beneficiado mucho en su negocio, nos cuenta que se lleva muy bien entre todas las socias tanto en el bankito como en su comunidad. El préstamo que hoy realiza es para invertir en la compra de  más ropa como: chompas, casacas,  las cuales le entregan en el puesto de venta.

Para obtener un mayor  surtido de ropa viaja a la ciudad de Cuenca para comprar en la Feria Libre, su meta para el futuro es construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.

María vive en la Estancia a unos minutos antes de llegar al cantón Paute, tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda hace 17 años y no se ha vuelto a casar, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9, 5 años de edad, su primer hijo concebido en su matrimonio esta en el colegio cursando el 4to año, el segundo y tercer hijo cursan el 5to año de educación básica y el jardín en la escuela de la comunidad, no son reconocidos por su padre y llevan el apellido materno.Ttienen casa propia pero se encuentra en muy mal estado a punto de caer, viven cuidando una villa.

María trabaja en la agricultura sembrando toda clase de hortalizas, también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, pollos, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. todos los días, por lo que no se debe descuidar del riego de sus hortalizas, de cortar la  hierva para los cuyes y estar al pendiente de la criaza de los pollos, este es su segundo crédito y se lleva muy bien con sus compañeras, es  una de las socias mas alegre y divertida en el grupo, el préstamo que hoy realiza  los va a invertir en la ampliación de su criadero de pollos y cuyes, su meta para el futuro es llegar a tener una buena casita donde pueda vivir dignamente.

Zoila vive en la parroquia el Cabo, sector la Estancia, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre hace muchos años, siendo su esposo un gran apoyo en su hogar, fruto de su amor procrearon una niña que tiene 12 años de edad, está en el colegio cursando el primer año, no tienen casa propia, viven cuidando una villa, se dedica a la crianza de animales como son los cuyes, pollos, chanchos, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, las que vende en los mercados de Paute y Gualaceo.

Lleva 6 meses trabajando independientemente y no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en la crianza de sus animales, nos cuenta que trabajar así tiene muchas ventajas por que no se descuida de los quehaceres domésticos, de su esposo y pasa más tiempo con su hija.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando junto a la FUNDACION ESPOIR, y esta muy agradecida ya que se pudo desenvolver por si misma e independizarse en un negocio propio; el préstamo que realiza lo va a  invertir ampliando su criadero, en la compra de alimento para sus animales y la compra de semilla para su huerto.

El sueño que tiene para el futuro es de seguir trabajando para darle una mejor educación a su hija y tratar de que nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
The Red Roses Community Bank is located in La Estancia, Cabo parish, in Paute canton, in a tourist area of the province of Azuay. People visit the region because of its tropical climate, its fields of flowers, and the wide variety of fruit grown there. The Community Bank is made up of fourteen members. They are all very friendly and lively, get on well together, and are good neighbours. They work at different jobs, some in their homes and some out in the community. Here are some examples: Gloria lives in La Estancia, a community located just a few minutes outside of Paute. She is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband. They have a good marriage and get on well together. They have three children, aged 10, 9, and 8, who attend the local school. They don’t own their own home so they live in a part of the house owned by her parents. Her husband works as a driver and is a mainstay of the household. Gloria is a businesswoman selling clothing from her own stall in the San José de Paute market and from her home too. She’s had this business for four years and works from 9am to 5pm every day of the week. As she serves customers from her home too, she works in the evenings or whenever her customers arrive to buy items. She carries a wide variety of clothing for men, women and children. This is her second loan and her business has benefited greatly from the money. She says that all is going well with the members both within the bank and within the community. The loan she is asking for today will be used to buy more clothes such as sweaters and jackets which she sells from her market stall. In order to get a greater variety of clothing, Gloria travels to Cuenca to buy at the Feria Libre. In the future she would like to build a house and expand her business. María lives in La Estancia which is located a few minutes outside the canton of Paute. She is 39 years old and has been a widow for 17 years. She has never remarried. She has three children aged 16, 9, and 5. Her oldest son is in the fourth year of secondary school. The second is in fifth grade of primary school, and the third is in the local kindergarten. The children are not recognised by their father, and they have kept their mother’s last name. They do have a house of their own but it is in poor condition and on the point of falling down. They live in another house which they take care of. María works as a farmer growing all sorts of vegetables. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens. She works from 8am to 5pm every day as she has to water her crops, cut grass for the guinea pigs, or care for the chickens. This is her second loan and all is going well with her colleagues at the bank. She is one of the most lively and entertaining members of the group. This loan will be used to expand the guinea pig and chicken farm. In the future her goal is to have a nice home where she can live proudly. Zoila lives in the parish of El Cabo, in the neighbourhood of La Estancia. She is 29 years old and has lived with her partner for many years. He helps a great deal in the home.
