They have a daughter aged 12 who is in first year of high school. They do not own their own home but live in another house which they take care of. Zoila earns her living by raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She also grows vegetables which she sells in the Paute and Gualaceo markets. Zoila has worked for herself for the last six months and has had no problem raising the animals. She says that working independently has many advantages, as she doesn’t neglect her domestic duties, or her husband, and she has more time to spend with her daughter. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Fundacion Espoir, and Zoila is very grateful as she has learned to cope by herself and become an independent businesswoman. She plans to use this loan to expand her farm, buy food for the animals and seeds for her vegetable garden. Her dream is to continue working so that she can give her daughter a good education and never want for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, animals, feed, seeds

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa que lograron adquirir a base a mucho esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la preparación de banquetes, los cuales elabora para diferentes eventos; como fiestas de cumpleaños, bautizos, matrimonios, etc. A María le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite realizarlo desde su casa, además de tener tiempo libre para estar con sus hijos. Los días que tiene pedidos son muy ajetreados, desde la mañana hasta la entrega, y generalmente le demanda mucho tiempo y dedicación; felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, los cuales aminoran la carga de trabajo. Adicionalmente, María alquila algunas habitaciones, negocio que también le da ingresos extras para su economía. Ella quiere dedicarse de lleno a esto, ya que le resulta muy rentable este negocio, es por ello que quiere construir su casa para poder tener más cuartos para alquilar. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en todos  sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará utensilios de cocina y material para la construcción para la ampliación de su vivienda.

loans.use: Compra de utensilios y ampliación de su vivienda

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 37 años, vive con sus 3 hijos: Jean Pierre de 17 años, Coni de 13 años y Grecia de 3 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, negocio en el cual incursionó al poseer chacras donde siembra chala (maíz), apio, poro, entre otros vegetales, vendiéndolos  en el mercado “Huamantanga”, uno de los más conocidos de su localidad. Ninfa vende al por mayor, pues trae la mercadería en grande cantidades, ofreciéndola desde las 5 de la mañana, que es la hora cuando los comerciantes minoristas se abastecen, por lo que termina sus ventas a 10 de la mañana y regresa a su domicilio a preparar el almuerzo para sus hijos. Por la tarde, vuelve a reunir los vegetales para repetir el mismo procedimiento al día siguiente. Ninfa se encuentra muy feliz porque ve que poco a poco va progresado su negocio, y esto le da una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable a la hora de realizar sus pagos cuando trabajaba en grupo, lo cual es un buen precedente. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 37 years old and has 3 children: Jean Pierre (17), Coni (13), and Grecia (3). They live in their own home. Ninfa has been selling vegetables for 8 years. She travels to various farms to acquire corn, celery, leeks, and other vegetables and sells them in the Huamantanga market, the best known market in the area. She buys in large quantities so that she can sell her products wholesale.

Ninfa begins selling vegetables at 5am, the time when most merchants receive their inventory. Her sales end around 10am, which gives her time to return home and prepare lunch for her children. In the afternoons, she collects her next supply of vegetables so that she can repeat the same routine the following day. She is happy with her business because she can see how it slowly progressed over time and how her family’s quality of life improved.

Ninfa is receiving her first individual loan from MFP. When she worked with a group, she was always responsible in making her payments. She will use the money to purchase vegetables in greater quantities in order to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her supply of vegetables

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Copo de nieve” pertenece a la familia de pro-mujer hace tres años aproximadamente, se reúnen en el centro focal  Villa Exaltación,  ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con dieciséis miembros activos y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Actualmente su presidenta es  Marina Catillo. Diversos son los  negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de tubérculos ( papa, oca,  chuño y tunta ),elaboración y venta de comida,  venta de ropa, verdura, víveres  y otros. La asociación Copo De Nieve desea  comprar  mercadería y/o insumos, de esta manera aumentaran sus ganancias con el único objetivo de mantener estabilidad económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Copo de Nieve Association has been a part of the Kiva family, Pro-Mujer, for approximately three years. The members meet in the Villa Exaltación centre which is located in the town of El Alto. Currently there are sixteen active members—they have shown themselves to be a well-organised group with regard to their loan repayments. At the moment the president of the group is Marina Catillo. The members have a variety of businesses, for example selling vegetables such as potatoes, oca, chuño (freeze-dried potato), and tunta (dried potato). Other members prepare and sell food, clothing, vegetables, groceries, etc. The Copo de Nieve Association would like to buy more merchandise and/or ingredients so they can increase their profits in order to have financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and food ingredients

loans.name: Norah

texts.es:
La señora Norah, es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, ella pudo estudiar educación superior pero no la concluyó.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para su negocio de venta de ropa americana.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir alimento balanceado para animales (granos), ella también tiene su negocio de molino, para el servicio de molido de diferentes granos.

Su deseo es surtir mejor su negocio y que así pueda crecer.

A ella le gusta la responsabilidad en los pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de alimento balanceado para animales

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
La señora ANA MARIBEL V. T., tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad,  quien depende económicamente de ella.
ANA  se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares en  ferias , como: borradores, cuadernos, reglas, lapiceros, papelería en general, regalos, etc.
En su casa ha colocado 3 telefonos publicos para locutorio.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas útiles escolares para la tienda de su casa.
 ANA sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maribel V. T. is 24 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Jerusalén”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has a 3 year old son who is financially dependent on her.

Ana sells school supplies at the markets such as erasers, notebooks, rulers, pens, stationery, as well as gifts. In her home, she has installed three public telephones for her call center.

Her loan of 300 soles will be used to buy more school supplies to sell from her home. Ana hopes to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to sell from her home business

loans.name: Vanesa Rosalía

texts.es:
La señora VANESA ROSALÍA ARTEADA H., tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 1 hija de 5 años de edad,  quien depende económicamente de ella.
VANESA  se dedica a la venta a la venta de ropa y utensilios de cocina en la sierra liberteña. Viaja quincenalmente a vender sus productos.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra ropa para niños, damas y caballeros.
Este crédito de 1300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra ropa que traerá de Lima, accesorios como: relojes, pulseras, aretes, peines, etc.
 VANESA sueña con alquilar un stand en el centro de Trujillo, donde pueda vender ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
texts.en:
Sra. Vanesa Rosalia Arteada H. is 23 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Jerusalén”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has a 5 year old daughter who is financially dependent on her.

Vanesa sells clothing and kitchen utensils in the mountains of Liberteña. She travels every 2 weeks to sell her products. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy clothing for children, women, and men.

Her current loan of 1300 soles will be used to purchase clothing that will be shipped from Lima, as well as accessories such as watches, bracelets, earrings, combs, etc. Vanesa dreams of renting a booth in central Trujillo where she can sell clothing for children, teenagers, and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & accessories

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 02 hijos, ella estudió educación primaria completa, vive en el Sector Los Ángeles.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a comprar ovinos para hacerlos engordar y luego venderlos en las ferias zonales.

Su deseo es mejorar su situación económica y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She completed her elementary school education and lives in the region of Los Ángeles. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 6 months. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy small livestock (sheep). She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 800 soles to buy more sheep to fatten so that she can sell them at the regional fairs. Sra. Sabina hopes to improve her economic situation and educate her children. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de septiembre”, en el centro poblado de M. del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir animales menores.

En la Actualidad ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra de ganado menor como ovinos y cerdos.  Luego de engordarlos los venderá.

Su deseo es ser mayorista en venta de ganado.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “22 de Septiembre” (September 22), which is in the central town of M. in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 24 years old, single, and has 3 children. She completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Her fist loan of 300 soles was used to acquire small animals.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase small livestock, such as sheep and pigs, to fatten for resale.

Sra. Gloria hopes to become a livestock wholesaler. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and being on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & pigs

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “22 D. septiembre”, en centro Poblado D. M.  del distrito D. D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la primaria incompleta (3er grado).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir animales menores.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra D. ganado mayor como vacas, los venD. en las ferias D. ganado en Ilave y Acora.

Su deseo es tener muchos animales y vender a los mayoristas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de vacas.

loans.name: Miriam Isabel

texts.es:
La señora MIRIAM ISABEL V. M., tiene 26 años, vive en el distrito de La esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta sexto de primaria  y no pudo continuar sus estudios porque se comprometió con su esposo a los 14 años, tiene 3 hijos de 11,10 y 5 años quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
MIRIAM  se dedica a la venta de ceviches, tallarines ,y papa a la huancaína en su domicilio.
El crédito de 350 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de 2 meses , bancos  y utensilios de cocina 
 MIRIAM sueña con tener en su casa su tienda de productos alimenticios.

loans.use: lo invertirá en la compra de 2 meses , bancos  y utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Rosa Paula

texts.es:
La señora ROSA PAULA V. S., tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria  , tiene 4hijos de y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
ROSA  se dedica a la confección  de ropa de vestir para damas , caballeros y niños.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de telas , hilos, tijeras, etc
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de mas materiales de costuras para cubrir unos pedidos y también confeccionar prendas que ofrecerá a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos.
 ROSA   sueña con asociarse con una amiga y tener un pequeño taller de costuras.

loans.use: compra de mas materiales de costuras para confeccionar prendas

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es:
La sra. Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad D. Puno, provincia D. Puno, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda,  y es madre D. 3 hijos (2 a su cargo), ella estudio educación primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en el Barrio Alto Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra D. abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella lo va invertir en su tienda D. abarrotes, para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, gaseosas; así mismo ella se dedica a la venta D. artesanías en miniatura y viaja a todos los santuarios D. la región para venderlos.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando  especialmente en su artesanía en miniaturas.

A ella le gusta las facilidades en los prestamos y les enseña a ser puntuales.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 60 years old, widowed, and the mother of 3 children (of whom 2 are dependents). She has a first graD. education and lives in the neighborhood of Alta Bellavista. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used as capital to purchase groceries. At the moment, she is requesting another loan in the amount of 1200 soles to invest into her grocery store. She will purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, and sodas. Sra. Cristina also sells miniature handicrafts and travels to all the shrines in the region to sell them. She hopes to continue working with her miniature handicraft business. Sra. Cristina likes the ability to access credit since it has taught her to be punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, and sodas

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca C. a sus 59 años de edad se dedica a la actividad de venta de alimentos ubicándose en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario oferta sus platillos a sus clientes.

Actualmente ella se esfuerza grandemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar y por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima con el cual va a preparar los alimentos. Espera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 59 years old and sells food from her own business in the Mayoreo Market in Managua, Nicaragua. Daily she offers her dishes to her customers.

At present, Blanca works very hard to provide sustenance for her household. For this reason, she has approached CEPRODEL to obtain a loan to buy basic foodstuff with which she can prepare her dishes. She hopes to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FOODSTUFF TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: Albina Bibiana

texts.es:
La señora Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera,  y es madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para aumentar su capital para la compra de utensilios de cocina.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella lo va invertir en la compra de utensilios para el hogar tales como ollas, tazas, platos, cristalería, thermos, etc.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando  

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the Señor de la Justicia Community Bank in the city of Puno, located in the province and district of Puno. She is 60 years old, single, and the mother of two children. She completed a primary school level of education. She lives in the neighborhood Bellavista. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, an amount she used to increase her capital and purchase kitchen utensils. Currently, she is asking for another loan of S/. 1200.00 Nuevos Soles. She will invest this money to purchase utensils and other tools for the home such as pots, mugs, plates, glassware, thermoses, etc. She hopes this loan will allow her to continue working. She appreciates the access to and terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of pots, mugs, plates, glassware, thermoses, etc.

loans.name: Juana Amelia

texts.es:
Juana es una madre soltera de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo de 3 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y, eventualmente, a la venta de sábanas y enseres para el hogar, lo que percibe de estos pequeños negocios le sirve para cubrir los gastos de educación de su hijo y para ayudar a sus padres a solventar los gastos económicos diarios del hogar, ya que ellos son de edad avanzada y no pueden trabajar.

Ella desea crear un pequeño bazar en donde pueda vender los productos que usualmente ofrece de manera permanente, es por ello que ha solicitado a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de productos de belleza y contar con un stock regular de mercadería para ofrecer al público.

A Juana ya se le ha apoyado con un crédito anterior que ha cancelado puntualmente por lo que es considerada como una cliente responsable y confiable.
texts.en:
Juana is a single mother and is 41 years old. She lives with her 3-year-old son at her parents’ house which is located in the city of Ferreñafe, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has sold cosmetics by catalog and eventually she began also selling sheets and household items. This small business helps her to cover the costs of education for her son and to help her parents cover the daily household economic expenses, since they are elderly and cannot work anymore. She desires to create a small store where she can sell the products that she usually offers in a more permanent way. It is for this reason that she has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from our institution. She wants to use the loan to purchase beauty products and count on a regular stock of merchandise to offer to the public. Juana has already been supported with a previous loan that she repaid punctually and because of that she is considered to be a responsible and reliable client.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
El señor José de la Concepción M. es un caballero muy responsable que ha sabido ganarse el pan de cada día por medio del digno trabajo y de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y de juguetes en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la mercadería como es juguetes y electrodomésticos y por esto espera muy confiadamente en que será beneficiado con el crédito y logrará satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor José de la Concepción M. is a very responsible gentleman who knows what it means to earn his bread every day by his honest labor and to bring home the bacon to his humble abode. He works selling home appliances and toys in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. The reason he has approached CEPRODEL is to seek a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as toys and home appliances. And so he confidently hopes that the loan will be approved and he will be able to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, y es madre de 2 hijos, ella estudió educación secundaria (completa), vive en el Barrio Huascar.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para aumentar su capital para la compra de calzados.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo invertirá en la compra de calzados que los encarga a la provincia de Trujillo.
Su deseo es  continuar trabajando  

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de calzados.

loans.name: Rosa Cefelmira

texts.es:
La señora ROSA CEFELMIRA P. G. D. O., tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria  , tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella .
ROSA    se dedica a  la fabricación y perfilado D. calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene en su domicilio
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. materiales para la fabricación D. sus zapatos, sandalias, como: cuero, plantas, pbc ,plantilla ,etc.
Este crédito D. 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra D. mas materiales para la fabricación D. su calzado.
ROSA sueña con exportar su calzado a las diferentes provincias del Perú.

loans.use: lo invertirá  en la compra de mas materiales para la fabricación de su calzado

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Bismark M. se dedica a la venta de pollo en su propio establecimiento donde a diario ofrece el producto a todos los visitantes del mercado.

El motive por el que ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es porque requiere de la compra del pollo para su venta en su localidad y es por este motivo que no duda en solicitarlo en Ceprodel para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, Mr. Bismark M. sells chickens in his own store, where daily he offers chickens to all of the market’s visitors. He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel because he needs to buy chickens to sell in his store. Because of this reason, he is requesting the loan from Ceprodel to continue with his business so that he can bring sustenance to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 63 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 8 hijos (3 ya casados), ella estudio educación secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio las Cruces.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprar, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, yogures, jugos, chisitos, gaseosas.

Continuar trabajando y algún día poner una tienda.

A ella le gusta la cuenta interna y la forma de pago.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris is a member of “The Brooms” (Las Retamas) Community Bank in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 63 years old, is married, and has 8 children, 3 of whom are already married. She has not completed secondary school. She lives in the Las Cruces neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movements for 6 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of sweets. At present, she needs a loan for 1200 nuevos soles, with which she will buy cookies, chocolates, caramels, yogurt, juice, chizitos (a type of snack), and soda. Her dream is to continue working and someday to be able to have a store. She likes personal accounting and the form of payment.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chocolates, caramels, yogurts, juice, chizitos, and soda

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 59 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 8 hijos (dos independientes), ella estudió educación primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizo en su negocio de preparación de chicharrón.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de venta de chicharrón,  comprara carne de chicharrón, papas, chuño, ocas, camote, etc. también hace huatia de ocas y camote (comidas típicas) y lo vende en el mercado, siempre hay clientes. 

Su deseo es comprar materiales para construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.

loans.use: Para la compra de carne de chicharrón, papas, chuño, ocas, camote, etc.

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
El caballero Santos P. se ha dedicado desde hace 8 años a su negocio de venta de calzados ubicandose en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. El señor Santos ha logrado desarrollar su negocio ya que inició vendiendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha venido mejorando su situación en el negocio.

Ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los calzados y de esta manera exhibirlos en sus estantes para su venta. Espera que el crédito le sea de mucho beneficio para continuar mejorando su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos P. has spent 8 years working at his business, which sells footwear and is located in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. Mr. Santos has succeeded in growing his business; he started selling a few products, but over time, he has begun improving the circumstances of his business. He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so that he can buy footwear and then exhibit his products in his stands for sale. He hopes that the loan will be beneficial to him, so that he can continue improving his business in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Lelia

texts.es:
La señora Lelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 4 hijos, ella estudio educación segundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizo en su negocio de preparación de chicharrón.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de venta de chicharrón, y va a comprar carne de chancho, papas, chuño, etc  para venderlo en el mercado, su esposo a veces le ayuda cuando esta sin trabajo ya que es constructor.

Su deseo es continuar construyendo su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de carne de chancho, papas, chuño, etc

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es:
Desde hace 20 años, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Rosario H. se dedica a vender productos escolares ambulantemente por todo el mercado ofreciendo lapiceros, libretas, marcadores, borradores, entre otros.

Ella está comprometida a llevar el sustento a su hogar y para ello se esfuerza grandemente en la actividad. Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos escolares y así venderlos ambulantemente en el mercado y mejorar su condición de vida por medio de su actividad.

loans.use: Compra de artículos escolares

loans.name: Jenner

texts.es:
Jenner tiene 36 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 20 minutos de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años maneja un taller de mecánica que se especializa en la reparación y mantenimiento de motos lineales y mototaxis (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el negocio ha sido su fuente de sustento durante este tiempo y, debido a su experiencia y capacidad, se ha vuelto muy conocido entre los mototaxistas de la ciudad de Ferreñafe que acuden a él al presentarseles cualquier desperfecto en sus unidades móviles.

El está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de repuestos que utiliza diariamente en su trabajo.

Jenner vive en una casa alquilada y su mayor anhelo es construir una casa propia para vivir con los suyos y asegurarles estabilidad e independencia ,desea seguir creciendo como empresario y brindarle un buen futuro a sus hijos.

Los clientes de Jenner siempre están contentos con su servicio y lo consideran alguien reponsable y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Jenner is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, ages 1 and 7. They live in the city of Ferreñafe, located 20 minutes from Chiclayo. For 10 yearss he has operated a mechanic shop that specializes in repairing and maintaining motorcycles and motor-taxis (motorized vehicles used for transporting goods and passengers). The business has been his source of support during this time, and, due to his experience and capacity, he has become very well-known by the motor-taxi drivers in the city of Ferreñafe who come to him for help with any type of imperfection on their vehicles. For the first time he is asking our institution for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that he wants to invest in the purchase of spare parts that he uses daily in his work. Jenner lives in a rented house and his greatest wish is to build his own house to live with his family and ensure stability and independence for them. He desires to continue growing as a businessman and provide a good future for his children. Jenner’s customers are always content with their service and they consider him to be responsible and very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts to repair motocycles

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María es una madre soltera de 49 años de edad que vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 13 años en el pueblo joven Simón Bolívar, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 3 años ella tiene un puesto en el Mercado Sol de Oro, en la urbanización Las Brisas, donde vende toda clase de condimentos de cocina, con este negocio ella ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y día a día se esfuerza cada vez más para seguir llevando el sustento económico diario a su familia.

María tiene planeado ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos que ofrecer al público, por este motivo ha solicitado un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles a nuestra Institución. Anteriormente María ya ha solicitado a nuestra Institución 5 créditos los cuales ha cancelado puntualmente por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.

Su mas grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos realizados como profesionales y, siguiendo esta meta, trabaja con ahínco todos los días.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old and a single mother. She lives with her three children who are 16, 15, and 13 years old. They live in the town “Young Simón Bolívar” in the city of Chiclayo. For 3 years she has had a stand in the Sol de Oro (Golden Sun) Market in the development of Las Brisas (The Breezes) where she sells all types of condiments for cooking. With this business she has provided a good start for her children and she constantly tries to continue providing daily economic support for her family. María plans to increase her business by purchasing more products to offer to the public. This is why she has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from our institution. In the past María has already asked for 5 loans from our institution, all of which she has repaid punctually – for that she is considered an excellent client. Her biggest wish is to see her children become professionals, and working toward this goal, she works eagerly every day.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking condiments to sell

loans.name: 20 De Enero San Fabian Group

texts.es:
El banco 20 D. Enero San Fabian, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Huancavelica, Departamento D. Huancavelica. Es una comunidad muy organizada que en forma conjunta tratan D. salir adelante. La actividad principal D. la población es el Comercio.

Gladys es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Gladys se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. manzanas acarameladas y otros dulces, los cuales ella distribuye en los colegios D. su comunidad. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo D. S/. 500, con los cuales comprara manzanas y azúcar, insumos necesarios para elaborar sus productos.

Roxana es casada y tiene un hijo. Roxana, venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo, negocio que gracias a los prestamos que recibe, va creciendo cada día mas. Rozana solicita un préstamo D. S/400, con los cuales va implementar un puesto para la venta D. sus productos.

Yesenia tiene  una niña D. 03 años y es madre soltera. Yenesia, al quedarse sola se dedico a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y comidas en las ferias, lo cual le genero ingresos para poder  sostener a su pequeña hija. Yesenia esta solicitando un préstamo D. S/500 para comprar D. prendas D. vestir, para surtir su stock.
texts.en:
The January 20th San Fabian Bank is located in the community of Huancavelica in the department of Huancavelica. It is a very organized community in which together they try to move forward. The principal activity of the population is commerce. Gladys is married and has 3 children. Gladys makes and sells caramelized apples and other sweets, which she distributes to the high schools of her community. She is asking for a loan of 500 soles with which she will buy apples, sugar, and consumables necessary to make her products. Roxana is married and has one child. Roxana sells beauty products by catalog. This business, thanks to the loans she receives, is increasing day after day. Roxana is asking for a loan of 400 soles with which she will start a stand where she can sell her products. Yesenia has a three-year-old daughter and is a single mother. Yesenia, as a single woman, sells clothing and food in the markets. From these sales she generates income to be able to support her little daughter. Yesenia is asking for a loan of 500 soles to buy more clothing to supply her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 16 members of the community bank ask for a loan of 6,500 soles to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Irma Dora

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 3 hijos, ella estudio educación superior (bachiller en educación primaria), vive en el Barrio las Cruces.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con lo cual pudo adquirir víveres para la preparación de comidas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de servicio de llamadas y lo hace exclusivamente en las minas la Rinconada ya que nos indica que gana muy bien, por lo que comprara créditos para sus celulares.

Su deseo es poner un locutorio en el centro de la ciudad.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de creditos para celulares.

loans.name: April Grace

texts.en:
April Grace C. owns and operates a clothing business, providing general clothing services to local community members. She is 21 years old, single and has an infant child. She is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin. April Grace has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP.

In 2009, April Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. April Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

April Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José es casado,  tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 16 años de edad estudia su 3er año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 12 años estudia su 6to grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y de cuidar a sus hijos,  trabaja como docente en la Escuela el Buen Maestro desde hace 14 años; está solicitando  su 2do credito  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación),Silvio se ha destacado por ser responsable, honesto, trabajador, a pesar que son personas humildes son una familia pobre pero unida, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en  18 meses y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda con el apoyo que  AFODENIC les brinda gracias a los creditos que le financia, viven en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población, su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda, tener estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Silvio José is married and has two children. His son is 16 years old and is in his third year of high school, while his daughter is 12 years old and is in sixth grade of primary school. His wife takes care of the children and the household responsibilities, while Silvio works as a teacher at the Buen Maestro School, where he has worked for the past 14 years. Silvio is requesting his second loan from the institution, which he will use to improve his home by building another bedroom. Silvio has demonstrated himself to a good client because of his responsibility, honesty and hard work. His family is quite humble; they are poor but united. Silvio plans to repay his loan over the course of 18 months, and bit by bit improve his home with the help of loans given to him by AFODENIC. He and his family live in a neighborhood that grows a little bit each day. His dreams are to improve his home, to have a stable job and good health, and for his children to continue studying so that they will grow up to be someone in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build another bedroom

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita M. is from the city of Aloran. She is 60 years old. Juvita is single. To make a living, Juvita owns & operates a hog raising business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Juvita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juvita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Juvita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Juvita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Patrón San Juan Evangelista Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Patrón San Juan Evangelista, se encuentra ubicado en departamento D. Huancavelica, comunidad caracterizada por ser solidaria y organizada. Los pobladores D. esta comunidad se dedican básicamente al comercio.

Clarisa, es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Clarisa se dedica a L. venta D. carne D. animales, lo cual lo hace en las ferias o las reparte a domicilio bajo pedido. Clarisa, solicita un préstamo D. S/500 soles, con los cuales comprará mas animales para continuar su venta D. carnes  y sementales para L. reproducción D. su ganado.

Anny, es Casada y tiene  03 hijos. ElL., se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, entre ellas  verdura y frutas. Gracias a sus préstamo, su negocio a podido crecer, cada día tiene mas productos que ofrecer, lo cual le genera mas ganancias. ElL. solicita un préstamo D. S/1,000 para L. compra D. víveres, con los cuales abastecería su pequeña bodega.

Iris, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Iris se dedica a L. venta D. prendas D. vestir, negocio que inicio tras L. muerte D. su madre y con el cual pudo mantener y educar a sus hermanos menores. Iris, solicita un préstamo D. S/1,000 con los cual comprara prendas D. vestir en L. capital.
texts.en:
The Patron San Juan Evangelista (“Patron Saint John the Evangelist”) Communal Bank is located in the department of Huancavelica, a community known for its solidarity and organization. Most of the local residents work in commerce. Clarisa is married and has seven children. Clarisa sells meat at different markets and also makes home deliveries on order. She is requesting a loan of 500 soles, which she will use to buy more animals for her meat selling business and stud bulls to breed with her cows. Anny is married and has three children. She sells basic grocery items, like fruits and vegetables. Thanks to her loan, she has expanded her business, and each day she has more products to offer her clients and earns a bit more. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to buy groceries to stock her small store with. Iris is single and doesn’t have any children. Iris sells clothing, a business she launched after her mother’s death that has allowed her to care for and educate her younger siblings. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to buy more clothing in the capital city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nicefora

texts.en:
Nicefora J. is from the village of Bunawan near Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nicefora raises pigs for sale. She has been doing this for over 2 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP each month.

Nicefora joined PMPC in 2005 to gain access to financial services that would improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicefora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC, and is now requesting her 6th PMPC loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP,  to purchase breeding livestock.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Alberto Ramon

texts.es: Alberto Ramón está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en la escuela César Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 20 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor de 14 años estudia 1 er  año de Educación Secundaria y el menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga  de los quehaceres del hogar,  Alberto es un hombre honesto, trabajador y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, manifiesta que se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya con los 5 créditos obtenidos por la institución ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien, tener salud,  estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou B. is from the town of Aloran. He is 32 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a hog raising  business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marilou has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Marilou from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business . 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok M. H., age 37, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she sells fruits and groceries in front of her house, typically earning a gross income of US $12 per day. Her husband is a civil servant, earning US $3 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, H. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, H. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase more and varied kinds of groceries to expand her business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

To make a living, Aquilina owns & operates a hog raising business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Aquilina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aquilina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Vinancia

texts.en:
Vinancia P., age 60, is from the village of Tuburan. Vinancia is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Vinancia owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Vinancia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Vinancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Vinancia has successfully repaid three previous loans from PMPC. Vinancia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita B. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 48 years old. Edita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Edita owns & operates a food vending business in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Edita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Edita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Edita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Jocelie

texts.en:
Jocelie B., age 40, is from the town of Aloran. Jocelie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelie raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Jocelie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutcel G., age 25, is from the town of Aloran. Rutcel is married. To make a living, Rutcel owns and operates a manicure and pedicure business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Rutcel is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rutcel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rutcel is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services as well as to buy construction materials for their new house. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rutcel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Roth C. S., age 40, lives with his wife in the city of Phnom Penh. They have a school-aged child. To make a living, Roth provides transportation services at the markets and other nearby places, typically earning approximately $7.50 per day. His wife (pictured) is involved in a manicure business for ladies, also earning about $7.50 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. It has therefore been a difficult economic year for much of the country, and S. is among those affected, as the country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of these economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his family's income and to improve both his own business and that of his wife. He is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase more equipment for his wife's business. By doing so, he believes that she will be able to help raise the standard of living of their family.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his wife's beauty parlor

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn V., age 41, is from the town of Aloran. Carolyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carolyn owns and operates a hog raising business in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Carolyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Carolyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid six previous loans from PMPC.

Carolyn is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A., age 38, is from the village of Tuburan. Rosita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita raises pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
