loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly K., 38, was married with his new wife, Mrs. Phanny Un, 29. He has eight children: five sons and three daughters. Five of them attend school and other three are still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ly has been driving Tuk Tuk in Phnom Penh for four years. His wife has been selling Phak Lov in front of garment factory for two years. Phak Lov is a meal that cooked with pork. He is applying for his first loan of US$300 help capital is wife to purchase chicken and pork to make Phak Lov for sale.

loans.use: To purchase chicken and pork for resale.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao P., age 41, is widowed and has a child. She lives with her child who has been enrolled in a local primary school in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she sells breakfast (rice with roasted pork) in front of her house, typically earning approximately US $7.5 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1200 to rent a food shop to sell food and coffee for breakfast. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: rent a place to sell breakfast and coffee

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
M. sells fish door to door. Every day, she gets up in the early dawn and hurries to the riverside to wait for the arrival of the fishing boats. She then makes haste to the market, where she sells her wares at suitable retail prices.

M., age 49, is the mother of four children. Her husband is 55 years old and works as a motor taxi driver, making approximately $3 per day. Three of their children are still young and living with them, and one is married.

She sometimes gets to the market on her bicycle and sometimes rides there with her husband, if he is not working. This makes for unpredictable transport, which has been the cause of some difficulty. For this reason, M. has decided to take out a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike to serve as her business transportation.

She is driven solely by her wish that her children someday may have the opportunity to attain university degrees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business transportation to and from the market

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S., age 56, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she sells various kinds of fruit at a local market in the city, typically earning approximately US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by her three children who are currently employed as electricity technicians with an income of US $5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase more various kinds of fruit to expand her business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: fruit purchase

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S. L. is 38 years old and lives with her sister in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she and her sister sew and design clothes for her repeat and new customers, typically earning approximately US $10 per day.
 
The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, L. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Veang

texts.en: T., 31, married to Hung, 34, who run a service of selling meatball and other junk food for years and has given birth to four children all of whom are still young. T. has a skill of beauty salon so she run a service of door to door nail decoration to the surrounding neighbors since 2005 and she earns a good saving. Hung has been spreading his selling very well for he is good at making a delicious sauce with a red color. To catch up his family demand with the fours growing up, Hung wants to increase his income by selling much more meatball in quantity. That's why T. asks for a loan of $ 300 to buy more meatball from the producer for her husband selling. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: to buy more meatball from the producer for her husband selling.

loans.name: Chod

texts.en:
Chod S. is married and has two young children. He lives with his wife in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he is involved in a business as phone repairman at a local market in the city, typically earning approximately US $5 per day. His wife stays at home takes care the children who are too young to attend the school.
 
The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US $200 to purchase phone accessories and parts to expand his business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing phone accessories and parts

loans.name: Eab

texts.en:
Eab M., age 73, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in the city of Phnom Penh. To make a living, she rents part of her house to other people, provides public phone services, and sells phone cards in front of house, typically earning $5 per day. The family is also assisted by her son, who is currently employed as a motorcycle repairman with an income of $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This has resulted in a difficult economic year for much of the country, and M. is aM. those affected, as the country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, M. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $600 to exapnd her business to include such things as groceries, cigarettes, and additional phone cards. By doing this, she believes that she will be able to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her store's offerings

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mrs. Socheat C., age 32, and her husband, Mr. Vantha Vong, age 39, have been married since 1996. They have one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road No. 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Socheat has been a garment factory worker for nine years and Mr. Vantha Vong has been a vegetable farmer for 15 years. Socheat is requesting her first loan in the amount of $200 to use as business capital her husband’s farming business. The loan will be used for buying fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk T., age 43, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in the city of Phnom Penh. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of selling groceries, typically earning approximately $6 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children, who is currently employed in a garment factory and makes an income of about $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This has led to a difficult economic year for much of the country, and T. is among those affected, as the country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, T. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase an increased selection of groceries to expand her business. By doing this, she believes that she will be able to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase an increased selection of groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita is 32 years old and is a resident of Barangay Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela. She is happily married to Jomar, a simple farmer. They have been married for two years but do not yet have children. They hope that someday they will be able to start a family. This dream inspires them more than anything else to work hard.

Since their marriage, Genita has maintained a general store. She and her husband are working hard, not only to meet their daily needs, but also to save for their future family. At present, Genita would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise for her store. She hopes to obtain a loan of 10,000 PHP to use toward the growth and progress of her business.

loans.use: To use toward the growth and progress of her business.

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
At the foot of a big mountain is a small village of about two hundred families. L., age 36, lives in a house in this village. He has worked for many years as a statue decorator, working on statues of animals or the likenesses of such figures as Apsara, Hanuman, and Buddha.

Once he has finished decorating a statue, he needs a way of delivering it to his customers. He would like to buy a pair of buffalo as his method of delivery. To purchase these, he is hoping to obtain a loan in the amount of $1,000.

In the future, he dreams of having enough money to afford a bigger house.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffaloes for his peaceful delivering service.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania T. is a 72-year-old woman who lives with her farmer husband and their child, who is a teacher. The planting and selling of vegetables has been the couple’s source of income for 40 years. Through this business, they have been able to help their child graduate from college and have seen him attain a career in teaching.

Farming can be sporadic, and Epifania wanted to enhance their livelihood by starting her own business. She hoped to gather enough capital to start her own business of raising and selling vegetables. She also hoped to expand her pig-raising business.

In 2008, she joined ASHI and obtained a loan. With this, she financed her current business, and after repaying her first loan on time and with good performance, she was allowed to take out a bigger amount. This loan was used in her pig-raising business as well as to finance her farming business. Her livestock business has doubled in capital because a piglet that she bought for Php 2,500 could be sold for Php 6,000 after four months. Epifania could then buy two piglets.

Continuing her business with ASHI, Epfania wants to take out a larger loan in order to grow her businesses. She hopes to build a piggery in their back yard, since the lot is wide and less populated, surrounded by a wide rice field and vegetables. This is where she will house the piglets she raises. A small portion of the loan will also be used to finance her agriculture business.

loans.use: To build a piggery and to finance her agriculture business.

loans.name: Jogilyn

texts.en:
Jogilyn manages a general store business, located in front of their house, which is in Barangay Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. She wanted to expand her business by acquiring the additional working capital of PHP 6,000.00 from Kiva lenders. She plans to use the loan to purchase grocery items to sell, so as to maximize her profit and be able to provide her children with enough financial support for their education. She is very determined and is working hard for the development of her business.

Jogilyn believes that “when one works hard, he or she can fulfill his or her dreams.” Her dream for her children is to give them a complete education that will lead them to a better life and gainful employment. She is 40 years old, and she and her husband Venarcio are blessed with four children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hog raiser.  She engaged in this business for she wanted to help her husband in providing the needs of their family and also to maintain her business and somehow uplift their poor living situation.  Since she do not have enough capital to support the daily feeds supply of her hogs, she is now asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional capital. Aside from raising hogs, Elizabeth is also into retailing of bagoong” (shrimp paste) which she purchases from the nearest market and sell in their village.  She found out that this business is more productive and beneficial for her family.  

She is 41 years old and they are living in the simple village of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. They have four children;two are studying while the other two chose to stopped and work as housemaid to help them earn a living. 

Elizabeth is hoping to help all her children through her business.  She prays for all of them to always be in good health.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is a 53-year-old woman who believes that poverty is not a hindrance to success. She is widowed with six children, two sons and four daughters. She lives in Antipolo City in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.

Life was not easy for her after the loss of her husband because she has always needed to strive hard to care for and provide food for her children. She was deeply depressed and was almost at the point of losing hope. But her faith in God brought her strength to think primarily of the future of her children.

In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to gain access to capital for her business, which involves the selling of biscuits and rice. She applied her first loans toward her business and found that they brought her sound profits, since rice is the staple food for Filipinos and biscuits are in high demand, particularly by children.

Ermelinda is now requesting a loan of 18,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for assorted biscuits worth 3,000 pesos and 14 sacks of rice, all for resale. She is hopeful that the loan will be of big help to her business and she is looking forward to expanding her business. She also aspires to send her sons to school until they finish college and find gainful careers.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of biscuits and 14 sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en: A most admirable struggling woman from the far-away village of Pursat province, Cambodia, S. is a 60-year-old widow who lives in a house 12 poles tall with hundreds of thin red bricks as the roof, strong wooden sides as the the walls, and strong wooden stairs. She is a local farmer who has spent almost her whole life in the field, though she seems too old, she is a woman who can manage. The members of her house always appreciate and help her work. She can hire her neighbors to plow her field and grow the rice for a cheap and suitable fee. Recently, S. is requesting a loan of $100 to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Rennie

texts.en:
Ma. Rennie T. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 59 years old. Ma. Rennie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Rennie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ma. Rennie is just starting this business.

In 2006, Ma. Rennie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Rennie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Ma. Rennie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Ma. Rennie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hog raiser and a vegetable vendor in their village as her source of living.  She usually roam around their village when selling her vegetables.  She is very diligent in earning a living for their family.  Their poor living condition inspired her to work hard and dream big. Presently, Josefina and her family live in the peaceful village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela.

Josefina is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional capital for her hog raising and vending business. She aims to gain higher income to be able to provide the important needs of her family especially her children. She works everyday to attain her dreams.  She prays for the financial support of Kiva lenders and for her business to grow.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a 52-year-old businesswoman. She has food vending, crop production, and rice retailing businesses. She sends all of her three children to school out of the profit her businesses are making and also through the support of her farmer husband. From a loan she had when she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2000, she was able to start her food vending business. After several loans, she ventured into the crop production business. With her most recent loan, Nenita started a new business, which is rice retailing. With this business she had bigger profit thus, she thought of asking for a larger loan from ASHI to finance her plan of growing it. She wants to increase the volume of rice she sells and build a storage room for it. Someday, she wishes to become a wholesaler of rice in her village.

Since Nenita became a member of ASHI, her performances in terms of repayment, attendance during ASHI weekly center meetings, and in her businesses are excellent. This allows her to avail herself other types of loans from ASHI such as educational loans and house repair loans aside from those that are only meant for business. 

With the loans she has from ASHI, Nenita wishes that someday all of her children will graduate from college and will have their own careers.

loans.use: To buy rice and materials for a storage room

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
H., 58, is a widowed mother of five children. Two of her children are married and live separately, and the other three live at home and attend school. She plants different kinds of vegetables behind her house and grows rice on the farmland she inherited from her parents in 1980.

She owns a rice-milling machine that serves the whole village, and this supports the family with reliable income. In addition, the eldest son of the children still at home sometimes works part-time to help the family.

Recently, H. has had some difficulty with her machine, which endangers her primary source of income. For this reason, H. has decided to take on a loan of $300 to repair her rice-milling machine.

Her main goal is for the rest of her children to pursue their educations and finish university.

loans.use: To repair her rice-milling machine.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 41 years old. She and her husband Ernesto Jr. live and work in the village of Cabaruan in Cauayan City. Tessie maintains a beauty salon business in the market, and Ernesto manages a repair shop. They have a teenaged child named Jael Gaye, who is a college student.

Tessie worked as a teacher for almost three years before she decided to engage in her beauty salon business. Her salon is located on Cancillier Avenue in Cauayan City, and she has four staff members who assist her in providing hairdressing, makeover, and spa services. She also sells beauty products in the salon.

She wants the business to be well-known and hopes to expand it to other areas someday. However, she needs more capital, and with this in mind she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 50,000. With this amount, she is positive that she can turn her plans into reality.

loans.use: To expand her business to other areas.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
58-year-old Alicia T. is the wife of Nicholas, who is 66. Nicholas drives a tricycle, which is a sidecar attached to the body of a motorcycle used for transportation. Alicia is the mother of four children, two of whom still live at home. The two eldest children have their own families now. The second-eldest, their son Garry, is 25 years old and helps his parents financially by working as a tricycle driver, just like his father. His income augments his parents' income, with the primary goal of being able to sustain his youngest sibling's college education.

Alicia bought a tricycle six years ago for her husband to manage. The money for the vehicle came from her loan and savings in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI). She became a member of the institution in 2000. Her first loan was used for starting a business she could run herself: a business in food vending and selling. She gained savings out of her profits from these endeavors, and she thought of investing in something productive that would help her husband. This thinking paid off, for when Garry decided to quit school after high school, he could have his source of income by driving his mother's tricycle, allowing his father to have the occasional day off, which is beneficial to him, considering his age.

Alicia has great determination in her life, but she has always been disappointed that her three eldest children did not attend college. This has provided inspiration to her youngest child, who is eager to pursue higher education. The effort and industry she has seen from her mother in running her business has inspired her and given her reason to make good in her studies. She is determined to graduate from college.

The loan will be used for the franchise renewal of the tricycle and will also be spent for some necessary vehicle repairs. A small portion will also be used to finance Alicia's food vending business.

loans.use: To be used for the franchise renewal of and repairs to the business vehicle.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
“In order to uplift our family from poverty, we must learn how to prioritize things and learn to be hard-working enough. If we need money, then we need to look for money. But we must also remember to use it for its productivity," says Antonio.

Antonio has been managing his buy-and-sell business for almost two years. His income of PHP 3,000 a month is being used to support the needs of his three children. He is now asking for business capital in the amount of PHP 5,000, which he believes will make his business more productive and profitable.

Antonio has five children. Due to insufficient income, he was not able to send them all to college. Three are still studying and two of his eldest children are already working in Manila after their graduation from high school. His eldest works as a waiter and his second-eldest works as a helper.

He is not losing hope that someday, his three younger children will finish their college education.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita hails from the mountainous city of Antipolo in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her business partner is her husband, Ricardo, who is 54 years old. Estelita is the mother of two sons and three daughters, all of whom are grown. But the urge to strive for a living and to get out from poverty is still burning within her.

Her aspiration to cut the rope of poverty that ties her way to success caused her to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2004. She has applied her loans toward her fried chicken business. Specifically, she buys chickens, cleans and fries them, and sells the prepared food in the village. She even sometimes receives orders from other villages. This business has brought her enough income to support her family.

Now on her eighth loan, Estelita has requested a loan of 30,000 as additional capital for her fried chicken sales business. Part of the loan will also be used to finance her secondary business: she runs a general store where she sells such items as rice, charcoal, and meat. She been operating the business for several years and is hopeful that her business will continue to prosper.

Her aspiration is to expand her business and she dreams of having a space in the market someday. She also hopes to have a bigger and more durable house built on her own lot.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fried chicken sales business as well as for her general store.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles has been running a general storefor almost three years. She also works in the health center and she sells generic medicine. The health center gave her a monthly honorarium fee of PHP 625.00 from their village fund. Her business benefits the community because she can provide for the needs of her neighbors through her store. Her store is also a big help in supporting the needs of her family.  

Angeles is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in the rural village of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. Her eldest and second child are already college graduates and the third is now working in Midtown Pharmacy in the Roxas Public Market. Her youngest child is a high school graduate and she is hoping that he will pursue his studies in college.  

She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000.00 that will serve as her business capital. This will be a great help in improving her store making it grow.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 26 years old. Hazel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Hazel runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hazel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and serve as working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Hazel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Karimberdi

texts.en:
M. Karimberdi is a hard-working 53-year-old man who has considerably improved his economic situation by growing onions and potatoes. Karimberdi grows a native variety of onion and potato and sells these at the market. Now Karimberdi’s onion crop has grown and he wants to keep the vegetables safe and fresh for some time and then sell them later when the prices for them increase. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 3,500 Somoni in order to buy nets and other necessary items in order to keep his crop safe and fresh.

Karimberdi feels happy and privileged to be the father of five children.

He is very grateful for all of your help.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy nets and other necessary items in order to keep his crop safe and fresh.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina M. sells women's shawls in the central market of Istaravshan. For six years, she has successfully grown her clientele. She is 31 years old and is married with two children. Now Zarrina‘s business is her main source of income, allowing her to improve her family's living conditions and to provide her children with education.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy new shawls in order to increase her range of goods.

Zarrina would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy new shawls in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Relina

texts.en:
Relina is engaged in the hog raising business and is also sells dry goods in the village. She is hoping to borrow PHP 7,000.00 which she will use to buy feed for her hogs.

She is married to Dominador and they have two children who are both students in the rural village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela. Regina dreams of a progressive life for her family. She and her husband work hard to become successful in their small livestock and farming business. Relina considers her children as God’s greatest gift, thereby making them her inspiration to move forward. 
 
Relina is hoping for a loan to improve her businesses and become more profitable in the long run. Through the business that she manages, Relina hopes support her children's education. She really hopes that they complete their education because she believes that it will be the only way for them to improve their poor living conditions.

loans.use: Additional  Capital

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
M. Kurbon is an energetic man who has been a farmer for 15 years. He is happily married to a hardworking woman who always supports him. She has helped him get ahead in life and has given him 4 children. Like most other people in the zone who depend on the vegetable crop, Kurbon needs to buy agricultural supplies that will allow for the maintenance and production of his crops up to the optimum harvest time. With this purpose Kurbon applied to IMON International for a loan of 3500 Somoni to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizer. Kurbon and his beloved family sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina T. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 61 years old. Marina is single. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks commonly known as "shakoy" in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Marina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Oblaberdi

texts.en:
N. Oblaberdi, aged 42 years, is married and has two children. He earns his living through farming, specifically planting potatoes. Oblaberdi seeks room to expand the business and create an opportunity for his market, especially during the times he is waiting to harvest. He needs an alternative that can help him save for his children's higher education. Oblaberdi requests a loan of 4600 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.en:
N. Ibrohimjon is 33 years old. He is the loving husband and father of three children. Ibrohimjon has been selling different kinds of paints in the market for the past 6 years. For these years he had acquired the knowledge and skills required for his business. Since Ibrohimjon started his store, he was able to increase its clientele and in order to provide them with a good service, he is requesting a loan of $1500 USD, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase his assortment. With your help Ibrohimjon will get ahead.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en:
O. Abdujalil is 50 years old and lives in Istaravshan town with his wife who helps him with the living expenses. Abdujalil has three children who also help him. For 15 years he has worked his land which produces onion. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way. Abdujalil is requesting financing to be able to keep them in safety for sometime and sell them later when the prices for them will increase. For that reason he is asking a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy nets and necessary items in order to keep his crop in safety and fresh. Abdujalil is very grateful for all of you.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Tohir is now very responsible for his family. He is a hard-working person and he knows how every cent is spent in his business. With his desire to become a successful farmer in the future, Tohir is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to sustain the potato field entrusted to him by his father. Sometimes he is able to use the income from his business to extend financial assistance to his younger sister, who is currently studying. Tohir believes that by being an industrious person, he can become successful like other farmers in his village. He is proud of his choice and is really working hard to sustain and improve his farm.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Djumaboy

texts.en:
B. Djumaboy is 37 years old. Together with his wife they’ve raised 4 children. Djumaboy is running the drug store already for 12 years. He is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town which allows him to have many clients and customers. Djumaboy is the client of IMON for 3 years. Now he requests 8000 Somoni. Being very accurate person by his nature Djumaboy is sure and would like to ensure the lenders that he is able to pay the loan in time without any violations. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing medicaments for expanding the business

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
B. Munavar is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Munavar sells perfume and cosmetics. She has been in this business for 11 years. Munavar dreams of expanding her business, opening her own store, and establishing contacts with reliable suppliers of well-known products. Munavar and her husband work hard so that they have enough money to educate their children so that the children become highly-demanded experts in future. 

Today, Munavar is requesting 3500 Somoni to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics, such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick, etc.to increase the range of goods that she sells. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Kholbibi

texts.en:
For more than 20 years Kholbibi is running clothing sales business in the central market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is divorced and the mother of 4 children. She opened her business with the hope of supporting her children with everything they may need especially education. Her investment skills and integrity, combined with the assistance of microfinance loans through IMON International, have helped her to successfully and consistently grow her business. Kholbibi is a focused and generous entrepreneur. Currently she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to purchase inventory in bulk. With the additional profits, Kholbibi plans to work toward opening a department store in the local city mall. Additionally, Kholbibi plans to use extra profits to make home improvements and raise her family’s standard of living.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of development of business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Being born in a town where rice production is one of the most common livelihood of people, Elena and her 74 years old husband are used to be farmers since they were young. Parents of both were also farmers and that was their main source of income then. Elena has inherited a rice field from her parents however, she didn't have enough capital to maximize the land for a rice production (rice planting) business or any agriculture business. A piece of it was pawned to other people in the village to finance her only child's education until her graduation from college. In 2003, Elena decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)and get a loan to finance her rice production business that had started in 1999. She also dreamed then to get back the land they pawned.

Eventually after Elena's seventh times of loaning from ASHI she has able to have savings and have made their farming business grew. Her 35 years old only child who lives with her and her husband has been so supportive to her. Her loan presently which is intended for getting back her pawned land and finance her rice production business, is supported and agreed upon by her family. They promised each one that they will be helping each other for Elena to be able to payback her weekly payment in ASHI on time.

loans.use: Getting back a piece of riceland they pawned to other people and also to finance her rice production business.

loans.name: Marva

texts.en:
Marva is a member of the Mbagala east in kinyanambi,Iringa,she is 38 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 4 years.

Marva started her own Tailoring business 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Marva`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Marva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Faina

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Фаина торгует на рынке больше 10 лет.Раньше она торговала  женским  бельём,но после сотрудничества с нами расширила свой ассортимент товара.Она сама ездит за товаром в Истаравшан раз в неделю и в настоящее время привозит халаты,платья и пижамы.Она благодарна нам за моральную поддержку,что благодаря поддержки КИВА она увеличила свой капитал.Настоящий кредит берет на покупку женской  одежды.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Faina has been a market vendor for over 10 years. At first, she sold women's underwear, but after working with MLF MicroInvest, she expanded the range of goods she sells. Faina travels to Istravshan once a week to purchase inventory. Currently she is selling robes, dresses, and pyjamas. Faina thankful that with the support of Kiva, she has increased her capital. She is now applying for a loan to purchase women's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing wholesale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene manages a photocopying service in District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 29 years old and married to Jefone.  The couple have a five-year-old daughter named Jelene Annofe. In addition to their photocopying business, she also manages a computer printing business.

Knowing that education is important, Arlene is really doing her best to further improve their businesses for the future education of their child. Arlene wants to expand their businesses and eventually have another branch near the high school and college in Cauayan City.

To make the expansion possible, Arlene wants to borrow PHP 50,000 from Kiva lenders. With this amount, she believes that her dreams will become reality. 

She hopes to become successful in her chosen career and hopes for continuous business development.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a member of the kwamambo North,In Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 10 month`s,she also cares for other 3 dependents.

Evelina started her own shop business 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is evelina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more soap,sugar,wheat.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Evelina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more soda,sugar,soap

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 45 years old. She sells rice in the village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She also sells aluminum stoves that her husband assembles. With these businesses, Candelaria generates enough income to sustain the daily needs of their family.  

Candelaria wishes that her business will improve and, hopefully, will be known by others, especially her aluminum stove business.  To become more productive in the business, Candelaria is seeking financial support from Kiva lenders. She would like to borrow PHP 10,000. She also believes that having this amount will make her business grow more and will support the education of their children.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201050040) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 08 (8).


T. is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beef products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.006.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201050043) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.600.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Đặng Thị N. (20201050045) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Ngô Thị H. (20201050048) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.


4.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20201050070) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20201050040) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phú Mẫn 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t bò trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 6000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần T. để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201050043) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  Đặng Thị N. (20201050045) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Ngô Thị H. (20201050048) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


4.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20201050070) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M. is from the village of Poblacion 1 , Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In March 2009, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
“Try and try until you succeed.” This is the principle that Fe really applies in her life as an entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and married to Isidro, a security guard in Quezon City. Because of life’s difficulties, Fe strives hard and sacrifices everything just to give her four children a good education. Fe and her children are currently live in Barangay Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. Her husband visits them only once every two or three months because he works in Manila.

Fe sells hogs. She also sells frozen food (retail) that she usually purchases once a week. She sells her products on an installment basis. She now needs business capital and she would like to borrow at least PHP 8000.00 from Kiva lenders.   She will use the loan to maintain her hogs and improve her retailing business. She believes that her businesses are a great help in achieving the goals of their family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a member of the Mgodi North in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Getrude started her Tailoring own business 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Getrude first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material like vitenge.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Getrude hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and she is married to Melecio. Nenita and her husband manage a vegetable farm and vending business in their rural village of Banquero, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Sending her children to school is very costly, but they are doing their best to provide for the needs of their children and to achieve their ambitions in life.  

To fulfill her dream, she is now asking to borrow PHP 5,000 for their vegetable production and sales business. Nenita is hoping that lenders will give her the chance to improve their enterprise for the sake of their family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
“It’s better to give than to receive,” says Eddie, when he is asked about his principle in life. Eddie is a very generous person, not only to his children, but also to other people. He is married to Edelia who works abroad as a domestic helper. They have two children. The eldest is now looking for a job and their youngest is a nursing student. He and his wife are sacrificing a lot just to provide a better life for their children.  

To help his wife to meet the needs of their family, Eddie decided to engaged in the hog-raising business.  At the moment, Eddie has only one hog to raise.  He is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 which he will use to buy more piglets.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Mgodi North in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,She is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 20,18 years.

Maria started her own business selling pigs 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 1200,00 Tanzania shillings.

This is Maria first loan from BRAC_Tanzania ,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh i order to buy more pigs for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Maria hopes to save more money and expand he business.

Dolor L. T. is from the town of Aloran. She is 35 years old. Dolor is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Dolor raises and sells ducks. Dolor has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

Dolor is requesting a loan amounting to 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dolor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
