Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  G. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, G. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, G. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  G. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.256.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010007) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Thư (20213010009) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Trương Thị T. (20213010006) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


4.  Tô Thị X. (20213010059) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina has been operating a general store in the village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela for more than a year. She is 33 years old and married to Gilbert, age 34, who is a farmer in their village. Regina dreams of a good future of her three children. She plans to expand her business, and to make it a reality, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that this amount will lead to a progressive life and she can continue to send her three children to school. At present, they are all in the elementary level.  She hopes that she will be given the chance to achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Joses

texts.en:
Joses M. is a single young man who is 25 years old. He lives in Uthiru where he operates a video shop. He sells and rents video tapes, DVDs and CDs. 

Joses was introduced to KADET by his friends. He had never borrowed elsewhere. This will be his sixth loan and his repayment history has been good for all the previous loans. His business is unique because there are no similar ones in the area. Therefore, he stands a high chance of succeeding. 

He plans to spend approximately Ksh 50,000 to purchase a new motorbike, and use the balance of Ksh 30,000 to diversify his video library collection. The motorbike business is a new venture in the area and, because not many people have ventured into it and because the services are needed in the area, it is a very promising pursuit.

loans.use: Buying another motorbike for his new transport business.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Гульсара Юсупова -самая активная клиентка "Микроинвест",ей 39лет,замужем.Имеет троих детей и хорошего мужа,который помогает ей в бизнесе.У неё собственный магазин,где торгует её продавец-Зайниддин.Они продают технику и подарки.Гульсара закупает товар у поставщиков в месяц два раза.Она сотрудничает с нашей компанией больше года и ей понравилось наше обслуживание и намерена продолжать работать с нами дальше.

loans.use: покупка бытовой техники

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. helps her husband Ramiro run a motorcycle taxi business. He drives the moto, earning the income needed to meet the needs of their family including the education of their children. They are doing their best in sending their children to school. Three of them are in high school and the youngest is still in elementary school.

Aside from assisting her husband, Jocelyn also serves as a Barangay Health Worker in their village of Banquero Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She works as a preschool teacher and has a monthly honorarium of PHP 1,000 from the village funds which is also a big help in providing their basic needs. When there are no classes during summer, Jocelyn sells barbecue, boiled eggs, and snacks in the village to earn extra income. To help her husband in the maintenance of their taxi business, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 5,000 from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support a motorcycle taxi business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie N. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 38 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie sells seafood like fish and shrimp in the local community. Margie has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Margie joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase more seafood, and she is now requesting her 5th PMPC loan of 11,000 PHP.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase seafood for her market stall.

loans.name: Sharipha

texts.en:
Sharipha is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5children.Her children are aged 22,15,14,12 and 8 years.

Sharipha started her own clothing business selling clothes 12 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sharipha first loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy clothes.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan sharipha hopes to save money ,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Jovanice's Group

texts.en: Jovanice M. is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. She is 56 years old and a widow who cares for four dependents. Jovanice is a teacher by profession and has been a farmer in Rugarama for one year.  One of her strong points is providing good customer service. She works so hard to grow her business and to make sure she has a happy family. Jovanice needs a loan to help modernize her farm by getting quality seeds and to hire manpower to work the farm to ensure that she gets quality production. She is a friendly and determined lady with many dreams to realize.

loans.use: To modernize her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and the mother of seven children.  She is married to Beterciano who works as a welder and also drives a tricycle taxi. Their family lives in the village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. With the earnings from their small business, she hopes their children will be able to complete their studies. 

Josephine is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase materials needed to maintain their tricycle. She hopes to obtain the loan because it will help them continue to provide transportation services in their village. The earnings from the business are used for the education of their children and she is hoping to provide them a higher level of education to uplift their lives for the better.

loans.use: To maintain their tricycle taxi.

loans.name: Macklina

texts.en:
Macklina is a member of the secondary borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 30 yeras old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 14,12,and 8 years.

Mackilna started her own food business selling bites 12 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Macklina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more wheat,cooking oil.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Macklina hopes to save more money,pay school fess,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,cooking oil

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married with one infant.  Merlyn has been selling both food and daily use products in the local community for more than a year, earning about 1000 PHP a month.

Merlyn recently joined HSPFI hoping to access financial services that will help improve her ability to engage in business activities, and therefore her living situation. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her sale business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a food vendor in the village.  She lives in Binarzang,Quirino, Isabela. Aside from selling grilled foods like barbecue, also sells cooked snacks such as sweetened potato and banana. She wanted her business to become profitable.  With this she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000.00 for her business to grow.  She is very optimistic that lenders will somehow grant her request.

Lilibeth is married to Edison who is a simple farmer. She is 33 years old and a mother of three kids and they are now in the elementary level.  Lilibeth felt lucky for having a good and happy family. She dreams to send all her children to school until they finish their studies in college. She hopes to alleviate her family \from poverty through their hard works, patience and the continuous financial support of Kiva loans.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Three years ago, Sofia opened a general store. Having been a member of ASHI since 2000, she was able to borrow business capital in order to start her general store. Her husband's income from farming, which was the initial business they supported with their first loans, had been the family's other source of income until the present. 

To enhance her business, Sofia wishes to borrow money from ASHI. With that she will be able to buy the necessary equipment that would complete the service her store gives to people - like selling cold beverages and other frozen foods.

Sofia is happy and glad because she has the capacity now to grow a business. However, during her life she has regretted being poor. None of her four children have reached college. Although they now have their own family and their own sources of income, Sofia wants to establish a stable business which her children and grandchildren can inherit when she passes away, since their livelihoods are sporadic. With loans she gets from ASHI she will be able to continue to enhance her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her general store.

loans.name: Simon Njoroge

texts.en:
Simon N. is married with one child. He is 29 years old and he lives in Muguga, Kikuyu area. Muguga is a relatively busy shopping center hence, his customers are the daily shoppers. He has been in this business of selling charcoal(fuel) for the last three years and he intends to grow it so that he can establish a wholesale shop.

He got to know about KADET through a marketing done by KADET staff in the area and he had never borrowed from other sources before. This will be his third loan and his credit repayment history has been good and done on time. He will use the finance from this loan to restock the business.

He has zeal for this venture and believes that he will be successful.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying more charcoal so that he can restock his business.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Мавзуна -женщина средних лет,вдова и воспитывает четырех детей.Занимается бизнесом,продает дорогие ткани и женское пальто.Товар у неё пользуется большим спросом, так как таджикские женщины любят красиво одеваться в национальные наряды.А лето как раз сезон свадеб и мероприятий и все покупают новые материи для этого.Мавзуна хочет закупить на этот сезон побольше товара чтобы получить двойную прибыль,ведь такого шанса не бывает круглый год.Наша организация предоставила ей финансовую поддержку и она очень рада этому.

loans.use: покупка новых сезонных тканей

loans.name: Ronnah Mbithe

texts.en:
Ronnah M. is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kangemi where she operates her cafe. She has been in this business for six months now and Ronnah has seen her business grow within this time. She is  optimistic that, with enough capital, she will be able to expand it even more.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a KADET member, and she had never borrowed funds from other sources. This is her third loan with KADET, and besides the hospitality business, she also sells clothes for extra income.

Ronnah hopes and desires to establish her own cafe and expand it to a hotel, and even open another outlet elsewhere.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of supplies for her cafe.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane N. is from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business providing transport to people in her community using her motorcycle. Her husband also works as a motor vehicle driver. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In August 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials she needs to expand the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her transport service.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie S. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Charlie drives a taxi.  She has been doing so for over one year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.  Charlie joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlie has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, and now she is requesting her third PMPC loan (for 7,000 PHP) which she will use to repair her taxi.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To repair her taxi.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vỳ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1958. ( ID number: 010117130033). She lives in Xom Trong, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and her son. She has three children. Her First son and girl were married. Present, she and her husband have to raise a son. They have a store in the market. They sell clothes. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 vnd. This time, she wants to borrow 4.578.000 vnd ( or 265 USD) to invest in her clothes shop.

loans.use: to invest in her clothes shop.

loans.name: Nelson Ndung'u

texts.en:
Nelson I. is a 35-year-old married father of two children who lives in Muthure, Kikuyu.  He supplies water to homesteads and construction projects.  He also owns rental houses where he earns about KSH 4,000 per month.  Nelson was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member of KADET. He has borrowed from K-REP Bank before but this will be his first loan with KADET. He wants to use the loan to dig his borehole deeper so that he can have enough water for his personal use and for his business.  One day Nelson hopes to expand his water supply business by buying a truck to supply water in large quantities in addition to delivery with his donkey. In addition to all that, he would like to raise pigs on his farm.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To dig his borehole deeper for his water supply business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 40 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged  23 years.

Rehema started  her own food business 4 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,00 Tanzania shillings.


This is Rehema first loan from BRAC Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,0000 in order to buy rice,cooking oil.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rehema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice,cooking oil

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: Nuwajuna Ruth is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 32 years old and married with three children who attend secondary or primary school. Ruth has been managing a salon for four years in Omukagyera Trading Centre.  Over the years she has been able to increase her monthly profits to 110,000 UGX. She is a loyal person and this has won her more customers.  Her goal is to expand the salon further so she can earn more profits which she will use to educate and care for her children. This is Ruth’s first loan with the group and she will use it to buy more salon equipment to expand her business and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment like dryers and combs.

loans.name: Charles Kihiu

texts.en: Charles M. is 39 years old and married with two children. He lives in Muguga, Kikuyu, and he has been selling animal feed for the last five years. His business is in a center called Thamanda which is near where he stays. Charles was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member of one of the groups. Apart from KADET, where he has borrowed two loans, he has never borrowed money from another institution before. This will be his third loan and, so far, he has a good repayment history. Charles hopes to grow his business to a wholesale shop so that he can be distributing to small traders. He also wants to diversify his trade and start selling hay, since this is a farming region and he knows that he can get high returns and maximize on his profits by tapping into this new venture. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to restock his business

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khánh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1966. ( id number: 010102120006). She lives in Xom Vang, Co Loa, Dong Anh Ha Noi with her husband and two son. Her husband is a breakdown mechanic. Her two son are workers. And Khanh’s main job is farming. They have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 vnd. She is a group leader of five- member group. This time, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd(or 300 USD) to buy bike parts .
 About the other borrower in her group.
 Hiền Thị Nguyễn Was born in 1974. ( ID number: 010102120010). She has 2 children. She is a worker. Beside, she sells fruits in the market. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND( or 245 USD) to sell fruits in the market. 
 Hậu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1963. ( id number: 010102120008). She has 2 children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd( or 300 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.
 Gắn Thị Hoàng was born in 1953. ( id number: 010102120013). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.015.000 vnd ( or 300 USD) to buy more clothes.
 Đại Thị Trần was born in 1957. ( id number: 010102120007).  Her main job is farming. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd ( or 300  USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy bike parts

loans.name: Cris John

texts.en: Cris John R. is from the village of Landing, Camella, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cris John is currently engaged as a worker for a company. He has held this job for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. However, he is planning to engage in another business endeavor: he plans to raise pigs for sale. In 2009, Cris John joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase five piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 17,13,and 9 years.

Happy started her own food business selling banana,tomatoes 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn  monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Happy`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,banana.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Happy hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: Tobuy more potratoes,tomatoes,banana

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yến Thị Nguyễn (ID number: 010102150010) was born in 1960. She lives in Cho village, Co Loa, Dong Anh, Ha Noi, with her husband and two children. She and husband sell noodle soup but their main job is farming and, every day, they have to get up early in the morning. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. This time, Ms. Yến wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND (about 400 USD) to invest in her restaurant.

Ms. Yến is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA:

Nhàn Thị Nguyễn (ID number: 010102150019) was born in 1969. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about 290 USD) to sell sedge mats in the market.

Lan Thị Tuyết Trương (ID number: 010102150006) was born in 1965. She is a worker and, besides that, she raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD ) to buy feed for her chickens.

Thức Thị Trương (ID number: 010102150011) was born in 1964. She is a farmer and wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to raise pigs and poultry.

Tĩnh Thị Trịnh (ID number: 010102150012) was born in 1963. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (about 270 USD) to raise pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 28-years-old and married with one child. He stays in Kikuyu Town, which is at the outskirts of Nairobi. Kikuyu is a big business center hence Johnstone's business has enough room for growth. He mainly sells Potatoes in Kikuyu town and he has been doing this business for the last seven years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who was also a member at the time. Johnstone has borrowed from Equity Bank before but this will be his third loan with KADET. All his other loans have been repaid without difficulty and on time. He intends to diversify his trade and include different varieties of Beans in his stock.

He desires and dreams to be wholesale distributor of grains in Kikuyu Town with a stock of over two Million. He also intends to build a stall for his business instead of hiring as this will help him maximize on profits.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding stock by buying six bags of different types of beans

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad L. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 57 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Felicidad owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise for additional income. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu Thị Vũ (ID number: 010102150020) was born in 1972. She lives in Cho village with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a worker. Thu Thị Vũ raises chickens, geese and birds of peace. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (about 350 USD) to buy food for her domestic animal.

Ms Thu is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA:

Huệ Thị P. (ID number: 010102150014) was born in 1959. She has two children. She has a restaurant in which she sells noodle soup. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to expand her restaurant.

Dư Thị Nguyễn (ID number: 010102150004) was born in 1959. She makes votive paper. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about 300 USD) to buy more paper.

Lợi Thị Đào (ID number: 010102150002) was born in 1950. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to raise pigs and poultry.

Tuyết Thị Trương (ID number: 010102150003) was born in 1957. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to buy tonic water to sell.

Xuân Thị Đỗ (ID number: 010102150015) was born in 1975. She has three children. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (about 240 USD) to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for her domestic animal

loans.name: Isiah's Group

texts.en: K. Isiah is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a married man with a retail shop as his business on Bufunda Street in Ibanda. He sells products like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, flour and many others and he is able to make profits between 250,000/= - 400,000/= and he attributes this to the quality of his products plus the availability of enough stock. He hopes to see his business expand further as well as have a happy family. This is Isaiah’s 20th loan and he hopes to restock his shop with more products to avoid shortage so that he can be able to make more profits. He is so hard working and can do more with an additional capital.

loans.use: Restock his shop with more products.

loans.name: Maryvic

texts.en: Maryvic P. is from the village of Looc Proper. She is 36 years old and is married. Maryvic owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Maryvic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Maryvic is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza maintains a general store in the village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. Aside from that, she also ventured into selling vegetables, fish, meat, and frozen foods. She dreams for her business to become progressive and able to generate a bigger income for the benefit of her family.

Flordeliza is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders. She is hoping that someday she can expand her business and generate a good income for her family. Her business will be of great help in achieving their dreams, especially for the education of her children.

Flordeliza is already 37 years old and is married to Ferdinand, a farmer. They are blessed with three children who are all studying. She hopes someday that her family will succeed to a more secure and comfortable living.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
Bety is a member of the Muungano borrower group in Ilala,iringa.she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 18,13,8 and 5 years.

Bety started her own business selling clothes 10 years go,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Bety first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes like vitenge,kanga(fabric).

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Bety hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes(fabric)

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
64 years old Lolita and her husband live with their two sons and three grandchildren. Through Lolita's membership in ASHI, she has been able to purchase, six years ago, a tricycle (sidecar attached to the body of a motorcycle - used as a means of transportation) which her 33-year-old son is managing and getting his income from. Her loans have also financed her husband's farming. Most of all, it had made her an entrepreneur.

Lolita sells rice, gasoline for motorcycles, and dried fish in their own village. She chose to sell these items because they are the most salable to people, considering the village, which is very poor, lacks  accessibility to any kind of transportation and the market is very far. The fare alone when buying things people need in the market is already expensive. At least with Lolita's business, people don't need to go to market for the basic things they need.

Through loans she is able to get from ASHI, Lolita wants to expand her business and sell more items for the accessibility of her neighbors and other people in the village. She also wanted to help her children and sustain the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy commodities such as rice, gasoline, and dried fish

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul O. is 37 years old and the married father of one child. He lives with his wife, Margaret, and daughter, Mayah, in Mikindani, Mombasa where he runs a secondhand home-products shop. He trades in different household goods such as second hand sofa sets, electronics, fans and much more. His shop has been in operation for the last two years. This loan marks the first time Paul is borrowing from KADET. With the money he plans to purchase more sofa sets and electronics. In future he hopes to become a leading secondhand dealer in Mombasa and its surroundings. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand electronics and sofa sets

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa R. is from the village of Landing, Camella, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old, is single, and has three school-aged children. Marissa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In August 2009, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta N. is from the village of Puntod. She is 60 years old. Modesta is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Modesta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over 50 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Modesta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Modesta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester makes a living from her retailing business.  She sells different commodities in her small store like groceries, fruits and vegetables. She hopes to have more products to retail so that her business will become more profitable. In order to have additional business capital, Ester is requesting to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 that will surely enable her to buy more goods to sell.  Ester proudly shares that some store owners from nearby villages sometimes came to her store and buy her merchandise. She hopes her business will grow more till turns into grocery store and supply some small store owners in their village and also nearby villagers. According to her, the business is really of great help in sending her children to school.  

Ester is 57 years old and very diligent in her business.  Her husband Domingo is 59 years old and also hard working in managing their farm.  They live a simple life in the village of San Ignacio Quirino, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Joha

texts.en:
Joha is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 12 and 3 years.she also cares for other  1 dependent.

Joha started her own business selling cooking oil 2 years ago,she works 2  hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more cooking oil for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Joha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
M. Teddy is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a hard working businesswoman who has had a business selling matooke (plantain) from Katojo Cell for seven years. She is married with seven children and they are at the university and in secondary schools. Her business profits of 170,000/= a month give her a chance to pay their school fees.

Teddy ensures that she has good produce for sale and this gives her a chance to maximize her products depending on her stock and capital. She would like to make more profits as well as have a happy and healthy family.

Teddy needs a loan to be able to improve on her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizer for a better output. She is grateful for the previous loans because they have helped so much in her business and family welfare.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer for her banana plantation

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
For almost four years, Domingo is operating his passenger tricycle in their village at Barangay San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. His incomem from his transport business helps him in providing the needs of their family.  He can earn at least PHP200 a day.  Aside from his tricycle business, he is also engaged in hog raising business.  Having them the said businesses is really beneficial in meeting the needs of their family and in sending their children to school. 

Domingo is 31 years old.  He is a responsible father to his two children:Christine Imee, 7 years old and Crisha Mae - 5 years old. His wife is employed as a teacher in a public school in their village.  Domingo is now asking from kiva lenders a financial support amounting to PHP6,000.00.  This amount will be used to improve and maintain his motorcycle that he is using in transportation and also his hog raising business.  H

 Đoan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1972. ( ID number: 010102110013). She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd ( or 300 USD) to buy scrap- iron to resell.

texts.en: Annah is 50 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Kirigu, Kikuyu, where she sells milk on a retail basis to nearby shops and to households that are not, themselves, involved in farming. Annah got to know about KADET from her friend who is a member and she had not borrowed elsewhere before. This will be her third loan and, with this loan, she hopes to buy raw materials for the construction of rental houses to boost her family income. In future Annah hopes to construct a shop for her milk business and also to buy more cows so that she increases her milk supply. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

texts.en:
Artemia R., from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag Bukidnon, is a 54-year-old married mother of nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Artemia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop whose main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Artemia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. Sometimes she also gardens, cultivating crops for sale.

In 2009, Artemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of family members and expand the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. texts.en:

Her family has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

There are two other borrowers in her group. Duong T. T. D. was born in 1984. She is a dressmaker who has two children. She has a daily income of about 80,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy fabric.

Chien T. N. was born in 1982. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy wood to make chairs and tables to sell.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is a 36-year-old micro-entrepreneur residing in the big community of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. The place is along the Cagayan River and so villagers need to ride in a ferry boat when they are going outside the area.

Zeny manages a sari-sari store (community based store). For three years, she was able to prove that she can make her business grow. But she still wants more improvement and she is now asking to borrow from Kiva lenders a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for her store.

According to Zeny, she has lots of competitors and she sees it as a challenge. This motivates her to be patient and to work hard towards business development for the welfare of her two children.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba Q., from the city of Dapitan, is a 37-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Melba owns and operates a general store whose main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Melba joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering, Melba is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

texts.en:
Janette is 27 years old.  She and her partner have a child but they are not yet married.  She is a graduate of Criminology course but unable to practice her profession.  She now manages a village store and would like to request a business capital from Kiva lenders a loan of PHP7, 000. She would like her business to become successful for the future of her child.  

She is happy that she was able to earn a daily income of PHP300.00 from her store which is quite enough to meet their daily needs and for her three year old son.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
S. and Savy’s marriage gave them a family of two children all of whom are still young. S. is 45 and Savy is 47. He earns a living as a motor-taxi driver with a net of income of $3 per day. S. has been employed for almost two years by a private company offering massage services.

S. and her husband decided to take a loan of $500 to buy a new motorcycle to upgrade their living standard. She dreams of her children obtaining degrees.

This is Betina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh In order to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 33 years old, married, and has four children who are all studying. Her husband is a farmer and is also working as a tricycle driver in their village.

Margarita has worked for ten years in the sari-sari (community based) store business in San Ignacio. The income she earns from her store is carefully budgeted to meet the daily needs of her children and family. She would like to maintain her store's profitability and is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 7,0000.00. This amount will be of great help in providing for the needs of her family. Through patience and hard work, Margarita believes that her store will grow to meet her expectations.

loans.name: Annalie

Annalie A. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Annalie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annalie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not her only means of generating revenue, selling a variety of "viands" in the local community is Annalie's primary source of income. Annalie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 51 year old woman aspiring to become a successful entrepreneur. She has six children and two grandchildren living with her. Her husband is a fisherman,as is her eldest 27 year old child who has just an elementary education. The rest of her children and grandchildren range in age from four to 20 years old. Salvacion became a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2004. Previous loans from ASHI have financed her husband and son's fishing business, and her own variety store. The profits she made enabled her to send her children and grandchildren to school. Two of them are in high school and the rest are in elementary school. In addition to the businesses already financed by loans from ASHI, Salvacion would like to take a larger loan to begin a business raising pigs (hog fattening business). She hopes to start with two piglets. After four months, she will double her starting capital, and she will use those profits to double the number of pigs she raises.

Someday, when her business becomes successful with the help of ASHI loans, Salvacion can send all of her children and grandchildren to school until they finally graduate from college.

loans.use: To finance the sustainability of her variety store and also to start up another business raising pigs (hog fattening).

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Jyldyz, a farmer’s wife who works on the land and raises cattle in order to share her husband’s hard labor. Fourteen years ago, Jyldyz and her husband obtained a piece of land upon which they began growing wheat. Since then, they have bought a car and raised four children, providing all of them with college educations. Three of her three children, two sons and a daughter, have already married and live separately with their own families, so only their youngest son, 23, who is a student, still lives with them. With only the three of them, it is easier to make ends meet, but as harvesting time is approaching, Jyldyz needs a loan to cover expenses on hired labor and fuel. With part of this loan she would also like to purchase wheat seeds in advance for lower prices. Among Jyldyz’s dreams that she is determined to fulfill are purchasing a house and car for her son and increasing the total population of their livestock.

Jyldyz has three partners: Elmira, Suyumkan and Ainagul. Elmira is 44, a widow and mother of three daughters. Having received a piece of land from the village council to farm on, Elmira needs a loan to purchase 1650 pounds of wheat seeds, pay for labor and buy fuel.

Suyumkan, 51, and her husband are farmers who grow wheat and sunflowers. Farming allows them to live independently, and Suyumkan needs a loan to purchase seeds and fuel.

Ainagul, 51, has raised five children. Having obtained land from the village council and investing in it, she has been farming for the last 18 years. Her monthly income is now $130, and she needs a loan to buy threads for stacking hay, fuel, to pay for labor and invest the rest in construction.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds in advance and cover expenses on hired labor and fuel.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
L., 51, is the widowed mother of four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married and lives separateL.. Two of her single daughters are on the staff of a private company that runs a massage center.

L. is famous for making delicious desserts and she has been in this business since 2005. L. is looking for a loan of $1,000 which, with her income and her daughters salaries, will enable her to renovate her house so that it is more comfortable.

L.’s onL. wish is for her children to finish university.

loans.use: To renovate her house to make it more comfortable

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Secondary borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 14 years.

lilian started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Liliani`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Lilian hopes to save more money ans expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a very assiduous woman. She is striving hard to provide for the needs of her family and to send her children to school. Everyday she roams around their village just to sell her products. She sells assorted commodities such as vegetables, bread and some cooked snacks and usually earns a daily income of PHP 100.

Remedios wishes to have a prosperous life. In this regard, she is now asking for business capital amounting to PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that through the loan, she can sustain her business and she can also help her husband in sustaining their farming needs and be able to continue to send their children to school. Remedios is also planning to put up a small stall in their village where she can display her products.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Esther Mafabi’S Group

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old and married with five children aged between 11 and 19 years. All her children are in school. She resides in and owns a three roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Esther takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a canteen in Naguru Go-down. She incurs extra transport costs from and to Nakawa. Esther sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last ten years and besides the canteen business, she sells charcoal.

Esther has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and merchandise for the canteen. Esther aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent home.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 55 years old and married with four children aged between 7 and 27 years. Three of her children are in school. The eldest child is in school. She resides and owns a one roomed house where she is staying with six people. Sarah doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a restaurant selling food and cold drinks. She uses public transport to and from home and work and also when transporting her food stuffs and crates of soda. Sarah sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

Sarah has been in this business for the last ten years and she has been with MCDT for eight years and is servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and food stuffs. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent home.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and food stuffs

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells yam powder and garri and she has been in the business for over 2 years. Toyin has been with LAPO Micro finance for the past year.

She is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more yam powder and garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri and yam powder to sell

loans.name: Matlida

texts.en:
Matlida is a member of the Bwawani borrower group  in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.


Matlida started her own business selling tomatoes 8 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Matlida first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatos ,banan,onions.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Matlida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,banana

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a village store owner in San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. Her desire to make her business grow leads her to request a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 9,000. She is very optimistic that this amount will assist her in the improvement of her store.

Maribel is 37 years old and married to Roberto, a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are now in the high school level. Maribel dreams that her children will finish their studies and have a stable job someday so that they can have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Phim's Group

texts.en: Always almost of the every dawn and late afternoon of the day, M. rushes to the riverside gather the fishes from her husband Bro, 28, on the a small fishing boat and hurries to the market selling at retails so that she will get a high suitable price. M. in the age of 29 years old has given birth to four children all of whom are still young and attend school. The family has now all of the fishing materials because of the great success they achieve. M. is asking for a loan to invest the selling of her fish to a more greater. She only dream of having degree for her children. She is a leader the other four members of the group. They are Khum, N., T., and S. all of whom spend their almost life on the water too. T. was not available during the photograph so her husband is taken instead.

loans.use: to invest the selling of her fish to a more greater.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 43-year-old single mother of five children aged between 9 and 27 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she lives with six people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Norah resides and works in an urban area selling handicrafts like table cloths and knitted sweaters in Mukwano Arcade, one of Kampala’s streets. She uses public transport to and from home and work. Norah sells to an average of ten people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

Norah has been in her business for the last ten years and has been with MCDT for seven years. She is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more thread and rolls of cloth. Norah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to owning a permanent home.

loans.use: To buy more thread and rolls of cloth

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling electronic load or communication (cellular phone) services in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for her e-load business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza C. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 33 years old. Maria Liza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Liza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Liza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Maria Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria Liza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Maria Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Zubairi's Group

texts.en:
G. Zubairi is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with eleven children and he also cares for his parents.

For ten years, Zubairi has been a businessman with a fish-selling business and also a secondhand clothes business in Iganga and Bugembe respectively. Both businesses have grown and he is able to make 20,000/= and 80,000/= as profits from the businesses. Zubairi needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes to sell and to buy more fish since an increased stock increases sales.

Zubairi is a friendly and a hardworking man and his goal is to have more businesses like rearing goats and poultry so that he could have more income; and for the goats, he plans to buy a plot where he will be able to keep them. He also strives to educate all his children.

loans.use: To buy more fish and used-clothes to increase his stock

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a member of the Bwawani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 40 yeras old woman,she is married and  a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 16,12,08 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.
Hidaya started her own grocery business 10 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 400,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hidaya`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer,soda.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Hidaya hopes to save more money,get more food for family,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida R. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Zenaida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saed

texts.en: Saed is a young man, 20 years of age, single, lives with his parents and three younger brothers , who are all in school. He owns a grocery store . He would like to use this loan to expand the capacity of his commerce by acquiring supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more, so as meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: acquiring supplies of new products for his store

loans.name: Poeu

texts.en:
S., at the age of 32, has much experience growing vegetables and selling fish and vegetables. She is taking a loan to buy fertilizer for her field and materials for her husband's fishing business.

Her life partner, Hoeurn, 36, is famous, for he is good at fishing. He hands his catch from the river to his wife to sell in the morning and late afternoon at the market. The couple also take time to care for their vegetables growing behind their house. When the vegetables are harvested, S. will take them to the market to sell them at for a good price.

S. wants all her children to finish university.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field and materials for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy N. is 37 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a businessman. She lives in Kirigu, Kikuyu, a semi-urban center with many businesses. Lucy has been a landlady for the past year, renting out housing to local workers. 

Lucy got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member in a lending group; Lucy had never borrowed elsewhere before. This will be her first loan with KADET, and she wants to use the money (Kshs 20,000) to venture into a new business. She wants to start selling charcoal and later become a wholesaler, distributing to other small traders so as to increase her income base.

In the future, Lucy hopes to open and stock a general shop, in addition to constructing more rental houses on her extensive property.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To start up a new charcoal sales business

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with no children. She sells women's shoes at the central market in Belaya Tserkov. She started this business 16 years ago when her husband got very serious illness and she has to provide for the family herself. Later she found out she enjoyed selling the shoes and began to develop her business. 
Today Very has got many repeated clients and a large kiosk. She values Hope loans because they help her to develop her business. Vera would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase the fall collection of shoes. Additional income would help Vera to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the fall collection

loans.name: Sinun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinun C., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sean Sem, 33, were marred in 2003 and have three young sons. The family lives in Kosh Dach located on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sinun has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. In the past, she used to weave for her villagers to get fees. Now, she runs weaving business by herself. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving horse cart since 2007.
Sinun is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic A. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old, is single, and has an infant child. Marivic owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling electronic (cellular phone) load or communication services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a member of the Idunda B borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 25 years old woman,she is married.

Emelda started her Tailoring own business  5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Emelda first loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy materials.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Emelda hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Grishon N.

texts.en:
Grishon K. is 46-years-old and married with two children. He stays in Zambezi near Kikuyu town where he has been operating a bread supplies shop for the last four years. He normally does his supplies to small traders in the shopping center. 

He got to know about KADET through a marketing done by the KADET staff and he had never taken a previous loan with any other institution. This will be his third loan with after accessing and fully repaying the previous loans well and on time. Grishon hopes to grow his business and eventually own a big store to supply bread.

In future he plans to open a bakery so that he can do both the baking and distribution of bread.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding more stock of bread so that he can supply to more traders.

loans.name: Soa's Group

texts.en: A group leader S., 28, is a mother of three children all of whom are still young and attend school. Her husband Thy, 29, earns living employing as a labor worker along the riverside. S. earns her life by serving labor work as well. This is an educated family but a strong commitment of given their children to school to a high. Recently they have plan with their saving to renovate their house. That's why she asks for a loan. And the other rest members are O., K., and P.. They all employ as the labor workers in the private sector.

loans.use: to renovate their house.

loans.name: Mary Njoki

texts.en:
Mary Njoki is 49 years old and single. She lives in Kirigu, Kikuyu, where she has rental houses. She has been a landlady for the last two years.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who was a member of one of the groups. Mary has not borrowed from any other sources before.  However, she has already taken out and repaid two loans on time with KADET. This will be her third loan.  

Mary is very hardworking and industrious. She plans to use the funds to diversify her business into other areas so she can maximize her returns. This includes digging a water bore hole so that she can sell water because the area has a water shortage and to buy a water tank to store water. She also engages in dairy farming and desires to buy another cow for milk soon.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: investing in a water bore hole and buying a water storage tank

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children aged 22-5 years as she takes care of 4 relatives. She has a bakery business that she has had for 4 years and at the same time is involved in wood selling. She sells firewood that is used for cooking in schools, homes and hospitals. She ensures that she has enough raw materials for her bakery and firewood and she would like to be the largest supplier of bread in Wakitaka and Jinja town. She also wants to engage in farming and have a piggery business so that she could be able to clear her children’s school fees with much ease due to the increased income. Sarah needs a loan to be able to increase capital of firewood so that she could increase sales. She is indeed a hard working lady with many dreams.

loans.use: Buying more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 45 year married with five children aged between 51/2 and 18 years. All her children go Rosemary is a 45 year married with five children aged between 51/2 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she is staying with six people. Rosemary takes care of two additional family members aged 18 and 7.  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area owning a restaurant in one of Kampala suburbs.  She uses public transport to and from shopping. Rosemary sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees rent feeding the family She has been in this business for the last four years Rosemary has been with MCDT for four years and servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice cooking oil wheat flour sugar and salt.  Rosemary is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a house in the available plot she bought from previous profits 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil wheat flour  sugar and salt

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos State Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks for over 15years. She has been with LAPO Microfinance for the past 3years, Ramota hopes for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks so that she can meet her customer’s needs. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and provisions  to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 43 years old and married with three children. He lives in Zambezi, near the city of Nairobi, and operates a business near the bus terminal where there are many people and different business activities. He has been in the grocery business for the last six years.His customers are mainly passerbys and travelers. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing done by KADET staff.  Before KADET, he had never borrowed funds from other sources before. He has already taken out and paid back two loans with KADET.  With this third loan, Peter will be adding more stock to his grocery business.  His long term goal is to venture into dairy farming to supplement his grocery business.

About KADET:
