Depuis cinq ans, Pauline vend de beignets faits à base de farine de blé et la bouillie de maïs devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Pauline achète ses produits. Pauline est à son septième crédit avec ALIDé et Pauline rembourse très bien ses prêts. Les crédits d’ALIDé ont permis à Pauline d’améliorer le niveau de son activité ainsi que sa vie et celle de sa famille. Pauline sollicite ce prêt pour acheter en gros le maïs, la farine de blé et l’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Pauline was born on November 22, 1976 in Sègbohouè. She is married to Henri, a photographer. Pauline and Henri have six children to support, including five of their own. Some of them are in school. Pauline and her family have been living in Cotonou for six years. Pauline bears the family expenses along with her husband. Pauline is literate. For five years, Pauline has been selling fritters (made from wheat flour) and corn porridge in front of her house. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Pauline purchases her goods. She is on her seventh loan ALIDé and has repaid her loans. ALIDé loans have enabled her to improve her level of business, as well as her family’s living conditions. She’s requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale, wheat flour, and vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and flour

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
la sra. Maria del Rosario F. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion. tiene su pulperia hace varios años,  la cual no a surtido mucho de productos por la falta de capital para invertir. por tal razon es que solicita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Vive con su esposo y sus hijas, se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio al igual lo cierra a las 10 de la noche todos los dias.
Su meta es poder hacer su negocio lo mas grande posible, tambien tiene pensado en un futuro construir para acondionar mejor su negocio y asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario sells products from the small corner shop she runs from her home. She has had the shop for a number of years, though it is not very well-stocked with products due to the lack of capital to invest. For this reason she requests a loan in order to better stock her business and therefore satisfy the needs of her customers.

She lives with her husband and her children and rises very early in the morning to open her business, closing at an equally late time of 10 pm every day.

Her goal is to grow her business as much as possible and is also thinking of equipping her business better in the future so that she can better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her corner shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chimène

texts.fr: Chimène est née le 21/11/1980 à Adjohoun au Sud du Bénin. Chimène est mariée à ZINSOU Armand ; ils ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Chimène et sa famille vivent à Cotonou depuis huit ans. C’est Chimène et son mari qui supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Chimène vend chez elle à la maison dans une boutique qu’elle a ouverte à cet effet, des poissons, poulets, saucisses et ailerons congelés. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Chimène s’approvisionne en tous ces produits. Chimène a un an d’expérience dans cette activité. Chimène est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé. Chimène est un bon client qui rembourse bien ses prêts. Chimène sollicite ce prêt-ci pour diversifier son activité à la vente des œufs et huile végétale.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de poissons congelés, des œufs et de bidons d’huile végétale.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Mr. Teofilo is 43 years old and has been married to Mrs. Antonia Ramona Benitez for more than 14 years, together they have two children, one is 10 years old and the other is 20 years old and is in his second year at a Business Institute en the area. 
Mr. Teofilo is a native of the city of Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz, he began to work at a young age with his father making agricultural products, which they took to sell in the local markets. 
More than  8 years ago Mr. Teofilo began working independently because his father could no longer work due to his age.  Thanks to his strength and his work he made the money and was able to buy a small truck to distribute the merchandise in other cities.  
He is applying for this loan to buy merchandise (tomatoes, onions, carrots, milk, fruits, and others)

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, milk, fruits, and others.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda es una mujer comprometida con el progreso de su hogar, el cual está conformado por sus 6 hijos y su pareja, con quien trata de brindarles las comodidades posibles dentro de su casa. Desde que se casó buscó una actividad económica con la cual ayudar a su pareja y una de sus mayores habilidades es la preparación de comida. Es así que inició su negocio de venta de comida dentro de su casa, donde da pensión (servicio diario de almuerzo) a una cierta cantidad de albañiles que trabajan en obras de construcción por los alrededores. Hermelinda empezó con unos pocos comensales, pero ellos, al probar su deliciosa sazón invitaron a sus compañeros de trabajo, ahora tiene gran cantidad de clientes a quienes atiende hasta las 2 de la tarde. Terminando esta labor, prepara todo lo necesario para cocinar el menú del siguiente día. El deseo a futuro de Hermelinda es instalar un comedor más grande dentro de su casa, para así ir visualizando un restaurante donde atienda las 24 horas del día. Dentro de su banco comunal, los aspectos que más le gustan son el compromiso y la responsabilidad que se fomenta, hace 5 años que se formó su grupo y con este, llevan 8 ciclos de préstamos en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 1500 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán adquirir los productos e ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los almuerzos para sus pensionistas.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a woman who is committed to the progress of her family, made up of her six children and husband, with whom she tries to bring comforts to the home. When she was married she looked for a job to help her husband and one of her main abilities was the preparation of food. Consequently she started her business of selling food in her home, where she provides daily lunch service to a group of builders who work at construction sites in the surrounding area. Hermelinda began with a few builders at first, but after tasting the delicious seasonings on her food they invited their fellow workers. Now she serves a large amount of customers, who she attends to until 2 in the afternoon. After finishing with this work she prepares everything that she needs for the next day’s menu. Her wish for the future is to install a larger dining area inside her house, as she envisions owning a restaurant that is open 24 hours. The aspects that she likes the most about her village bank is the commitment and the responsibility that it promotes. It has been five years since she formed a group within Microfinanzas PRISMA, with whom she has gone through eight cycles of loans. The 1500 soles that she requests will allow her to purchase the necessary products and ingredients for the preparation of food for her daily lunch crowd.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of ingredients and products to prepare lunches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fustina

texts.en:
Fustina B. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Fustina has a small grocery shop where she sells tinned tomatoes and oil at Essuman near Secondi, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is an electrician. Fustina uses her income to assist her husband with the family's expenses.

Fustina will use the loan to expand her business by buying more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

Fustina was out of stock at the moment the picture was taken so she gathered a few samples of what she trades in.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying  more grocery items

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.en:
Virginia C. (third from the right) is a 33-year old woman who is taking out her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza. As the mother of four children (16, 12, 9, 7), she is excited about strengthening her business so she can better prepare them for their futures.

With this loan, Virginia will purchase jewelry from an area in the capital called Villa con Suelo, which is about an hour from her Los Alcarrizos home. In the past, she tried to sell perfume; however, she is now switching to smaller, less expensive items because she can sell more. Eventually, she would like to sell perfume again and open a small shop.

Virginia is also the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope Los Geranios. As the coordinator, she recognizes that it is her responsibility to help the other women invest wisely and attend the bimonthly repayment meetings punctually.

On behalf of Virginia, the Bank of Hope Los Geranios, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need them most!

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: San Pedro Y Pablo Group

texts.en:
In the city of Quiindy, in the Virgen de Caacupe neighborhood, 24 kilometers from the Carapeguá office of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, some women with limited resources joined the Mujeres Emprendedoras committee. This group decided to get together to receive information about the mentioned program. These active women, the majority of them dedicated to cleaning services, sales, as well as other activities mentioned above, are looking for some support to strengthen their families' incomes and to improve the quality of their lives through credit.

They will use this loan to invest in their respective jobs. By doing so they can attain sustainable growth that will help them to grow as a group and as individuals.

loans.use: To invest in their respective jobs

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa G. está muy agradecida por su gran aportación con el crédito anterior, y el cual le ayudo mucho en que su negocio creciera.
Ella nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para acondicionar mejor el salón de belleza que tiene ella y su hija, les está haciendo falta mas espacio y acondicionarlos, para poder atender a mas personas a la mismo vez y así poder darle trabajo a dos personas más. 
Pero en este momento no cuentan con el dinero para llevar acabo esta mejora es por eso que solicita un crédito, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Doña María Luisa y su hija planean pagar esté nueva mente el crédito con los ingresos que genera el negocio.
texts.en:
María Luisa G. is very grateful for the great contribution of the previous loan. It helped a lot in making her business grow. She is asking for a new loan to renovate the beauty salon that she and her daughter have. They need more space and renovations to be able to take care of more people at the same time. This way they could give work to two more people. At this time they do not have the money to carry out the improvement. That is why she is asking for a loan because she does not want to take money out of the business. María Luisa and her daughter plan on paying this new loan with the income the business generates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the location and buy more modern furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and some CD's to sell at his salon

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce P. is married to an electrician and has four dependents. She is responsible for assisting her husband to take good care of her children. Joyce has received junior high school education. Since 2005 she has run a small boutique at Essuman, near Secondi, where she sells clothes. She will use her loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of clothing for resale. Joyce hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer muy preocupada por los intereses de su familia, ya que el bienestar de sus hijos es lo indispensable para ella y su pareja, con quien comparte los roles dentro de su hogar. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la costura, pues desde pequeña tuvo interés por esta labor, la cual con, el tiempo, se convirtió en su actividad económica. María recibe grandes cantidades de prendas de vestir por parte de las fábricas, quienes contratan sus servicios para las diversas campañas; para ello, requiere de materiales para los acabados de las prendas, por lo tanto tiene que invertir en la compra de éstos. Sin embargo, su eficiencia la ha hecho reconocida entre las grandes fábricas y ahora tiene pensado realizar contratos con algunos programas del estado quienes están encargados de exportar productos peruanos, siendo así su próxima meta la consolidación de este beneficioso contrato. Su banco comunal ya tiene 4 años de formado, siendo la responsabilidad y el compromiso valores importantes que facilitaron su crecimiento y duración como grupo. Por lo que este sería el 7mo préstamo que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 1500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de hilos y diversas herramientas que requiere para el acabado de las prendas que recibe cada mes.

loans.use: Compra de materiales textiles

loans.name: El Bebe Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo El Bebe son Graciela María F. M., Daysi Arelys L. B., Astelia Nonhemi M. y Paubla de la Concepcion F. M.; Mujeres provenientes de La Comarca Campuzano, ubicada en la Ciudad de Nindiri.
Doña Graciela F. M. de 38 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo El Bebe, una mujer emprendedora que inicio su negocio a raíz de que su suegro le dio la idea de que pusiera una pulpería en su casa. Lo que la motivo para salirse de su trabajo en la Zona Franca de Tipitapa donde ganaba muy poco e inicio la venta de granos básicos en su hogar. Doña Graciela afirma que le va muy bien, y pretende invertir su dinero en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para ampliar su pulpería.

Éste es su segundo Ciclo de Crédito y a pesar de que ha enfrentado situaciones difíciles como un robo que le hicieron a su negocio, afirma que nunca ha quedado mal y va a sobrepasar todo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Las otras miembras del grupo Doña Astelia M. tiene 35 años de edad y vende comidas por las noches (Las famosas Fritangas Nicaragüenses), Doña Daysi L. de 21 años de edad quien elabora diferentes productos a base de maíz (Tamales, Tortillas, Yoltamal) y los vende ambulantemente y Doña Paubla F. de 49 años de edad quien distribuye cosméticos y vende joyería de plata en su zona.

loans.use: Compra de Otros articulos para ampliar el negocio

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty years old and is married with eight children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc.

Comfort deems this an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: The Divines Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Divinas, está formado por Maribel del Socorro P. G., Nora del Carmen F. C., Jeny del Carmen T. C. y Ana María C. G., provenientes del Barrio San Francisco de la Ciudad de Nindiri.

Doña Maribel P. de 30 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo; Una mujer Joven, quien aprendió su oficio de su Madre que posee un tramo en el Mercado Oriental (El mercado más grande de Nicaragua). De ahí nace su pasión por el comercio; afirma “Siempre me ha gustado este negocio”.

Cuando se independizo de su madre, decidió iniciar vendiendo productos accesibles que pudiera distribuir con facilidad y actualmente ha incrementado su negocio vendiendo Ropa y Lencería variada; Lleva ya cuatro años en el negocio y pretende seguir creciendo en éste.

Afirma que con los créditos a podido incrementar sus productos y satisfacer la demanda que tiene por parte de sus clientes, su crédito pretende invertirlo en seguir surtiendo sus productos y así poder recibir más ganancias para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene dos pequeños niños de 12 y 13 años con quienes sueña sean más exitosos en sus vidas.

El grupo las divinas tiene 2 años de estar trabajando con ADIM, éste es su quinto ciclo de crédito, y están muy satisfechas con el trabajo realizado.

Doña Jeny C. vende Repuestos de Bicicleta en su casa de habitación, Doña Carmen T. quien distribuye ropa en la Zona Franca y Doña Ana C. que posee una Fritanga (Venta de Comida por las noches) en su casa.
texts.en:
The Divines (Las Divinas) group consists of Maribel del Socorro P. G., Nora del Carmen F. C., Jeny del Carmen T. C. y Ana María C. G.. They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco in the city of Nindiri.

Mrs. Maribel P., 30, is the group coordinator. She is a young woman who learned her trade from her mother, who owns a booth in the Oriental Market (the largest market in Nicaragua). Her passion for business grew from there, stating, “I’ve always liked this business”.

She started her own business selling products that she could easily distribute. Now she expanded into selling clothing and lingerie. She has been doing this for four years and intends to continue to grow.

With previous loans, she has increased her products to meet the demand from her customers. This loan will be invested in continuing to grow her business to hopefully increase the revenues and improve her family’s life. She has two children, 12 and 13 years old, and hopes they have successful lives.

The Divines group has been working with ADIM for two years. This is their fifth loan and they are very satisfied with what they have accomplished so far.

Mrs. Jeny C. sells bicycle spare parts from her house. Mrs. Carmen T. sells clothes in the Free Zone. Mrs. Ana C. runs a small restaurant from her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of products to sell

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
A. Floride is married. She sells a variety of goods. Floride sells mainly food, including pasta, flour, peanuts, rice, and couscous (spherical granules made by rolling and shaping moistened semolina wheat and then coating them with finely ground wheat flour). She has been involved in this activity for three years. She buys her products in Cotonou, a large city about an hour away.

Floride has already received two loans from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, and they helped her to increase the size of her inventory. Floride is seeking a third loan in order to restock her goods. With more financial support, Floride hopes to someday start selling Beninese fabrics and jewelry.

loans.use: To buy more pasta, flour, peanuts, rice, and couscous

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty two years old and is married with two children who are currently in school. He is a petty trader and sells sponges, socks, shoe laces, curtain robes, etc. He sells through hawking (going door-to-door) and he has been in business.

He wants to use the loan opportunity to buy more sponges, socks, shoe lace, curtain robes, etc., to increase his stock of goods for sale. He hopes to raise an good income to pay his children’s school fees and to take care of the home. It is his desire to build his own house to reduce family cost and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase stocks like socks, shoe laces, curtains robe etc.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene  53 años, vive con sus hijos quienes son mayores de edad y trabajan de manera independiente, tratando así, de cubrir los gastos dentro de la casa. Desde que se separó de su pareja inició un negocio de venta de ropa y cubrecamas, las cuales vende de manera informal (al crédito) a los diversos amigos y vecinos de su localidad. Sus clientes aumentan cada vez, debido a la demanda que hay cada temporada, pues los productos que vende son importados del Ecuador, país que visita mensualmente con la finalidad de adquirir  novedosos artículos. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo por más de 10 años y el tiempo le ha ayudado a obtener experiencia para seguir invirtiendo, pero a veces la falta de capital dificulta sus ventas. Por ello, espera incrementar su mercadería y tener la posibilidad de adquirir un puesto de ventas estable en un centro comercial de su ciudad. Este es su 7mo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, los anteriores créditos le permitieron fortalecer su banco comunal, el cual conforma junto a un grupo de amigas, con quienes trabaja  con la finalidad de mejorar su situación socioeconómica. Los 1500 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería que requiere para la entrega de los últimos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Zoila is 53 years old and lives with her adult children. They have jobs and try to help with household expenses. After separating from her partner, Zoila started a business selling clothing and bedspreads (on credit) to various friends and neighbours in the area. Her customer base is always increasing as the products she sells are imported from Ecuador, a country she visits every month to obtain the latest products. She’s been doing this work for more than ten years so has gained much experience in knowing what to buy. However, sometimes the lack of capital causes her difficulties. Zoila hopes to increase her stock and perhaps one day have a permanent stall in a mall in the city. This is her seventh loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA. The earlier ones allowed her to build a strong relationship with the community bank to which she belongs along with a group of friends. Zoila and her friends are working to improve their socio-economic situation. The 1500 soles loan will be used to buy merchandise for which she already has orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Rosa De

texts.es: Carmen tiene un solo dependiente de 13 años de edad; tiene casa propia. Carmen rosa y su esposo el señor Fausto tienen 2 fuentes de ingreso 1) ventas de abarrotes o pulpería en el domicilio, 2) ingreso por su micro bus que trabaja en la línea 67. La competencia en el trabajo como mecánico no es alta ya que cuenta con clientela, de equipo pesado pero en la pensión la competencia es alta, pero cuenta con sus pensionados con una demanda similar. Los solicitantes  ocuparan el dinero para hacerle una mantención  a su micro bus. El crédito actual es su séptimo crédito u operación, con excelentes referencias de puntualidad.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa has one 13-year-old dependant. She also owns her own home. Carmen and her husband Fausto have two sources of income. They do in-home grocery sales. They also make money by working on micro-bus line 67, where the mechanical work isn’t as demanding as it would be if they were serving individual clients. However, it’s still necessary to use some heavy equipment, and there is a lot of competition for fares. Carmen and her husband will put this money toward maintenance for their micro-bus. This is their seventh loan; they have an excellent record of punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est née vers 1960 à Adjohoun au Sud du Bénin. Micheline est veuve et mère de huit enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Tous les huit enfants de Micheline ont été scolarisés, mais elle-même est analphabète. Micheline vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis quarante cinq ans. C’est la pâte de maïs que Micheline vent à son domicile. Micheline achète ses provisions à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Micheline a dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Micheline est à son sixième crédit avec ALIDé et rembourse bien ses prêts. Micheline sollicite ce prêt pour acheter en gros des sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Micheline was born around 1960 in Adjohoun in the south of Benin. Micheline is a widow and the mother of eight children whom she no longer has to take care of. All of Micheline’s eight children have received an education but she is illiterate. Micheline has lived with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin, for forty-five years. Micheline sells corn pasta from her home. Micheline buys provisions from Dantokpa, Benin’s big international market. Micheline has ten years’ experience in the business. This is Micheline’s sixth loan with Alidé and she repays her loans on time. Micheline is requesting this loan to buy sacks of corn in bulk.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en: Kweku is a 34-year-old married father of two children, who are currently in school. Kweku sells used jeans and khaki trousers on a pavement in Kasoa. Kweku has been selling for five years to support his household, and he says that selling jeans, khaki trousers and knickers, especially for men, is very profitable. With his loan, Kweku wants to buy bales of jeans, khaki trousers and knickers to increase his inventory and sales and earn good income. He believes this loan will help him save more money to rent a store since selling on pavements is not safe.

loans.use: To buy bales of used jeans, khaki trousers and knickers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 46 años, es una mujer caracterizada por su gran valor para sacar adelante a sus seres queridos, así como ser un apoyo para su pareja en los diversos roles que tienen como padres de sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Hace 5 años tuvieron la posibilidad de adquirir 3 motocarros, los cuales son de gran ayuda para la economía dentro de su hogar, Carmen es la encargada de administrarlos y velar por su buen funcionamiento. Estos vehículos los alquilan a diversas personas, generalmente jóvenes muchachos, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en la modalidad de taxi. Por tal motivo, Carmen se cerciora de que sean personas responsables y usen sus motocarros de manera adecuada. Por otro lado, las reparaciones y mantenimiento de las motos son esenciales y trata de hacerlas mensualmente, pues si hay una falla mecánica mayor, ésta evitará que se trabaje con una de las motos y afectaría su situación económica. Para un futuro cercano, Carmen espera ahorrar para comprar un motocarro adicional, con el que pueda cubrir los gastos si uno de ellos está siendo reparado. Ella trabaja de manera individual en Microfinanzas PRISMA y este es el segundo crédito que solicita, con el cual espera seguir mejorando su negocio. Los 3000 soles que requiere le permitirán comprar algunos repuestos para las motos y no tener ninguna dificultad futura con sus vehículos.
texts.en:
46-year old Carmen is a strong woman, determined to see her family get ahead in life. She is also a source of support for her husband in the various roles they have, such as parents of two children who live with them in the house which they managed to build after a great deal of effort. Five years ago they had the chance to acquire three ‘motocarros’ (three-wheeled motorized carts), which are a great help in making ends meet. Carmen manages the business and makes sure the motocarros are working properly. The vehicles are rented to various people, generally young men, who earn a living by transporting passengers in these ‘taxis’. For this reason Carmen checks that they are responsible people and use the motocarros in an appropriate manner. Repairs and maintenance are essential, and she tries to have them done every month to avoid a major breakdown which would affect their economic situation. In the short term, Carmen plans to save money to buy an additional vehicle which can be used to bring in money if one of the others is under repair. She is an individual borrower with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA, and this is her second loan. She plans to continue making improvements to her business. The 3000 soles which she is seeking will allow her to buy some spare engine parts so that there will be no future problems with the vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicles

loans.name: Loetitia

texts.en:
Loetitia is married and has one girl, who is 19 months old.  She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  She sells a variety of products , including cosmetics, fabrics, hairstreaks, shoes, and jewelry.   Loetitia is also a talented seamstress; she makes beautiful African clothing that is sold in Italy.  

Loetitia sells her products from her home.  As seen in her picture, she has a large sign that she displays outside to advertise for her business.  Her clients order at her home and she delivers the products when they are available.  Loetitia buys her goods in Togo and Nigeria, two countries that surround Benin.  She is thankful that she has loyal clients who always pay her on time.  

Loetitia has been involved in this business activity for four years.  She is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to buy more beauty products and to increase her sales.  Loetitia hopes to someday have her own boutique in which to sell her goods.

loans.use: Beauty Products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida está casada con Juan Felipe de profesión policía, tiene 3 hijas de 22, 20 y 15 años. Posee vivienda propia, en la cual vive con sus dos hijas menores. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de comida en el mercado de la ciudad. El esposo es policía  y está destinado actualmente en el Chapare. Se dedica a esta actividad, hace 15 años aproximadamente la competencia es alta, pero cuenta con clientela fija, la cual demanda sus productos  principalmente por la  calidad, sabor e higiene de sus comidas. El destino del crédito es para incrementar el capital de operaciones del negocio  y la compra de un freezer. El presente es el octavo  préstamo  al que accede Placida, con excelente comportamiento y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Placida is married to Juan Felipe—a police officer. They have 3 daughters ages 22, 20, and 15. They own a house in which they live with their 2 youngest daughters. She sells food as a street vendor at the city’s market. Her husband is stationed in el Chapare. She has been in business for approximately 15 years. Competition is high, but she has a fixed clientele that demands her products mainly because of the quality, taste, and cleanliness of her meals. This loan will be used to increase working capital and to purchase a freezer. This is Placida’s eighth loan. She is an excellent client who is very punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and purchase a freezer

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Carmen está formado por Doña Jerónima Alejandrina R., Rosibel Angélica T. M., Yamileth del Carmen C. G. y Álvaro de Jesús C. G.. Quienes provienen de una pequeña Comarca llamada San Francisco, ubicada en los alrededores de la Ciudad de Nindiri.

Doña Jerónima de 37 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo, una mujer de origen muy humilde, que no sabe leer, debido a que nació en un hogar de suma pobreza que le impidió estudiar y por consiguiente desde muy pequeña aprendió a subsistir con arduo trabajo. A muy corta edad aprendió el oficio de elaboración de tortillas con el que se sostuvo por largos años de su vida. Esto hasta que su esposo le animo a iniciar un negocio de venta de calculadoras, le enseño como invertir y como ver las ganancias de una manera eficaz.

Jerónima tiene 4 hijos de los cuales actualmente solo dos están estudiando, debido a que los mayores se desmotivaron de hacerlo, por eso sueña con poder aprender a leer y a pesar de su edad posee la convicción de lograr su sueño y con esto motivar a sus hijos mayores a superarse y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Este Grupo está iniciando el Onceavo ciclo de crédito y están muy contentos de poder seguir adelante, ya que con éstos se les ha facilitado el crecimiento de sus negocios.

Doña Rosibel T. vende frutas y verduras ambulante en Masaya y tiene tres hijos a los que espera sacar adelante; Doña Yamileth C. es profesora de educación primaria, pero debido a la difícil situación económica que se enfrenta en la actualidad, inicio un negocio de venta de Helados y Hielos en su casa y distribuye en  su comarca ropa interior por encargo y Don Álvaro vende en el Mercado de Masaya Granos Básicos.
texts.en:
The El Carmen group is composed of Doña Jerónima Alejandrina R., Rosibel Angélica T. M., Yamileth del Carmen C. G., and Álvaro de Jesús C. G. who come from a small area called San Francisco located near the town of Nindiri. 37-year old Doña Jerónima is the coordinator of the group. She comes from a humble background and doesn’t know how to read as she was born into a very poor home and was unable to go to school. Consequently, ever since she was a little girl, she learned to survive by working very hard. At a very young age she learned how to make tortillas which kept her going for many years. She did this until her husband encouraged her to start a business selling calculators. He taught her some business skills and how to deal with the money she earned. Jerónima has four children, two of whom are still in school. The two older ones lost interest. For this reason she dreams of learning to read, and in spite of her age she is determined to fulfil this dream and thus motivate her older children to better themselves and improve their lives. This group is starting its eleventh loan cycle, and they are very happy to be able to continue since with the money they have been able to expand their businesses. Doña Rosibel T. sells fruit and vegetables in the streets of Masaya. She has three children who she hopes will do well in life. Doña Yamileth C. is a primary teacher, but because of the difficult economic situation which she is currently experiencing, she started a business selling ice-cream and ice from her house. She also sells underwear in the neighbourhood. Don Álvaro sells grain in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Pascaline est née le 17/05/1980 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Pascaline est mariée à AWHANNOU Immaculé ; ils ont un seul enfant qui est scolarisé. Pascaline a fait des études universitaires et vit avec son enfant à Cotonou. Pascaline supporte les charges familiales avec son mari. Depuis trois ans, Pascaline gère une cabine téléphonique ; Pascaline y vend des amuse-gueules (bombons, biscuits, etc.).  Pascaline gère aussi une poissonnerie. Pascaline est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé. Pascaline a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Pascaline a été sérieusement malade mais elle s’est remise de sa maladie et a repris ses activités. Pascaline sollicite ce prêt pour diversifier son activité à la vente de fournitures scolaires. Pascaline ambitionne d’ouvrir une boutique pour vendre des fournitures de bureau.

loans.use: Achat de cartes de recharge téléphoniques et de fournitures scolaires.

loans.name: Inosencia De

texts.es: Inosencia tiene 47 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Teofilo tienen 5 hijos  su vivienda es en la localidad de Entre Ríos en la calle valle hermoso s/n. Nuestra cliente se dedica  al comercio de ropa nueva dentro el mercado central de la localidad y la venta de ganado vacuno, el ganado lo vende a los carniceros de la zona, aproximadamente 3 cabezas al mes, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la empresa termoeléctrica valle hermoso como jardinero. Cuenta con dos operaciones crediticias anteriores en las que demostró, puntualidad y cumplimiento en sus cuotas, el nuevo crédito solicitado destino en la compra de mercadería (ropa nueva).
texts.en:
Inosencia is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Teofilo. They have 5 children and live in the town of Entre Ríos on Valle Hermoso Street. Our client sells clothing at a street market, and has a cattle ranch. She sells approximately 3 head of cattle a month to the butchers in the area. Her husband works as a gardener for the Valle Hermoso Thermoelectric Company. She has had two previous loans, and she demonstrated to be punctual in repaying them. This new loan will be used to purchase merchandise—new clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital—purchase new clothing

loans.name: Sirayel

texts.fr: Sirayel M. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est veuve et a la charge de cinq enfants. Elle fait la transformation et la vente de jus de fruit. Avec son congélateur, elle produit également de la glace qu'elle vend. Les bénéfices qu'elle génére à, partir de son activité lui permettent d'assurer la dépense quotidienne pour sa famille et prendre en charge la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sirayel M. is a 59-year-old woman. She is a widow and has five children to support. She produces fruit juices and sells them. With her freezer, she also produces ice cream, which she sells. The profits she generates from her business enable her to ensure her family’s day-to-day expenses are covered and to look after the health of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her business selling fruit juices and ice cream

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
M. Christine is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. Her daughter recently took the Bac and will attend university next year. Her son is 14 years old and is in school. For three years, she has been running a small general store where she sells various goods. She buys her products at the Ouando Market in Porto-Novo. 

Christine’s brother helped her open her shop a few years ago. After acquiring her first loan from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, Christine was able to start selling gasoline. Christine is seeking a second loan from Alidé in order to restock her store. In particular, she would like to buy wood, diesel fuel, soap, pasta, and couscous. With more financial resources, she hopes to someday acquire the funds to buy a grinder that turns corn into flour.

loans.use: To purchase wood, diesel fuel, soap, pasta, and couscous

loans.name: Hernan Freddy

texts.es: Hernan tiene 40 años de edad. Su esposa se llama Natividad y tienen un hijo de que depende de ellos. Hernan se dedica al transporte de taxi desde hace 5 años y su esposa vende productos de belleza por catalogo y también joyas. Tiene su casita propia en la cual viven desde hace 5 años atrás. El crédito se destina para la reparación de su vehículo y para realizarle mantenimiento en general. Es un regular cliente que ha tenido algunos atrasos pero no son significativos.
texts.en:
Hernan is a 40-year-old man whose wife’s name is Natividad. They have one dependent son together. Hernan has been a taxi cab driver for 5 years, and his wife sells beauty products by catalog and jewelry. He has owned a house for 5 years. This loan will be used to repair his vehicle and give it general maintenance. He is a regular client who has had some minor issues.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Nieve

texts.es: Nieve tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. En el crédito participa su papa quien es lustrabotas, no tienen casa propia pero cuentan con todos los servicios básicos. Nieve se dedica a la venta de tarjetas de teléfono y su papa es lustrabotas quien también tiene un punto de llamadas en su lugar de trabajo. Cuentan con varios años dedicados a esta actividad, tiene mucha competencia por el tipo de negocio pero también se puede decir que tienen clientes fijos ya que el papa trabaja de lustrabotas en la puerta de un puesto policial siendo todos ellos sus clientes en la lustrada de las botas. El crédito lo destina para cancelar el saldito que aun deben y también para la compra de más tarjetas telefónicas para su negocio. Son buenos clientes que pagan sus cuotas con mucha puntualidad.
texts.en:
Nieve is 31 years old, single, and does not have children. She cosigned a loan with her father, who is a shoe shiner. They do not have their own home and but they do receive all basic services. Nieve sells phone cards and her father has been known to set up his shop at the same place where she works. Having several years of experience, Nieve knows that there is plenty of competition in her line of work. However, most of her regular customers also get their shoes shined by her father, who usually sets up his post by the door of the police station.

Part of her loan will be used to pay off her other debt, while the remainder will be used to buy more phone cards for her business. Both Nieve and her father are good clients who make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of another debt & operating capital to buy more phone cards

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is twenty-six years old. She is wife and mother of two children, currently her children are in school. She is a trader who trades in jeans clothes, blouses and skirts, women’s slippers, dressing bags etc. she has been in this business for three years. Augustina says her working capital is very low and therefore not adequate and this does not enable her to purchase high quantity and quality products. She believes that, with the loan she will be more resourced to meet the taste and preference of her customers. She wants to use the loan to include the sale of garment clothes, lace cloth, linen materials.

loans.use: To include the sales of garment clothes, lace and linen materials

loans.name: Harry

texts.fr: Harry Diaïté est une femme de 52 ans, elle est veuve et a en charge ses trois enfants. Elle développe une activité de vente d'huile de palme dont elle a une bonne expérience pour l'avoir exercé depuis plus de six ans. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la nourriture de ses enfants et d'assurer leur suivi sanitaire.
texts.en:
Harry Diaïté is a 52-year-old woman. She is a widow and has three children to support. She is developing a business selling palm oil. Having run this business for over six years, she has good experience in it. The profits realized from it enable her to provide food for her children and to ensure that their health is monitored.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her self-financing capacity for developing her business selling palm oil

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es casado con la Sra. Sandra. Tienen dos hijos de 19 y 10 años respectivamente. Poseen un bien inmueble propio en el cual se encuentra funcionando el negocio. Oscar se dedica a prestar sus servicios  de cerrajería, bicicleteria y gomeria,  la conyugue atiende el negocio de comida el cual está instalado en su domicilio, ambos atienden sus negocios hace 19 años aproximadamente. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad, experiencia, calidad,   rapidez e higiene en el servicio, les ha permitido mantener buena clientela, la cual demanda permanentemente sus servicios. El destino del crédito es para incrementar el capital de operaciones del negocio. Quinto préstamo  al que accede Oscar, con excelente comportamiento y puntualidad en sus pagos.  No registra atrasos ni mora en ninguna de sus cuotas.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El  grupo los bailarines está formado por 3 vecinos, que se conocen desde hace muchos años, y establecieron una relación de amistad y de crédito. Don Blas Antonio F., de 78 años de edad, varón dinámico y con gran espíritu de liderazgo, a pesar de su edad es el coordinador de este grupo, destacado por su energía, potencial, su alto grado de responsabilidad pero sobre todo por su humildad, es el que organiza al grupo.

Don Blas nos cuenta que inició su negocio, con dos cajillas de Coca-Cola y una bolsa de pan, que vendía en su humilde casa, actualmente muy orgulloso alega contar con gran variedad de productos como lo son: Granos Básicos, Queso, Confitería, Pollo, Coca-Cola, pan, entre otros.

Padre de 7 hijos, todos mayores de edad, Blas dice estar contento de no depender de ellos y pretende seguir adelante; ¨Mientras Exista, Tengo esperanza¨ dice Blas.

Está muy contento con la oportunidad que ADIM le brindó, ya que por medio de ésta ha sacado adelante su negocio y pretende seguir invirtiendo puesto que los clientes lo prefieren a él, debido a la atención que les brinda y la manera como les sirve. Así va a recibir más ingresos y de ésta manera sobrellevar con mayor facilidad las dificultades que enfrenta en su hogar como lo son la salud de su esposa.

María Ines M. M., de 25 años de edad, vende cosméticos en su comarca y Jenny Vanessa M. G. tiene una tienda de variedades como los son ropa, zapatos, cosméticos. Ellas son las otras dos integrantes del grupo los Bailarines.

loans.use: Compra de diversos productos, para ampliar su pulpería

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes P. is single. She has received schooling through junior high. Agnes sells Hair creams, relaxes, shampoos and other cosmetics at Bla in Hohoe. Agnes is solely responsible for her feeding, clothing and other financial commitment.  With the high demand for Agnes cosmetics and hair product, she plans to use the loan to purchase more of the cosmetics and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest into the business.

loans.use: she plans to use the loan to purchase more of the cosmetics and sell.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est une femme de 25 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Depuis 2004 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara foulbé 2. Depuis son adhésion dans ledit Banc Villageois elle développe un petit commerce de vente d'huile de palme et de produits halieutiques. A domicile, elle a aménagé une case qui lui sert de boutique. Cette activité lui procure des ressources financières qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari en participant à la nourriture et la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Maïmouna D. is a 25-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two children. Since 2004, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2. Since joining the aforementioned organization, she has been developing a small business selling palm oil and seafood products. At home, she has fixed up a hut serving as a store. This business brings in the financial resources enabling her to support her husband by helping to feed and look after the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capital to grow her business

loans.name: Inuisa

texts.en: Inuisa is 23 years old, single and dependent. For the past two years he has worked as a taxi driver. He picks up passengers from the local lorry station and takes them to the nearby towns at a transport fare of between ¢45p and ¢50p per head. However, his business is in crisis of late because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs. Inuisa is therefore requesting a loan to buy a new engine for his taxi so that he can resume his business and make some income. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his taxi

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 35 years old. She is married with four children. Currently all the kids are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits etc. in the local market. She also sells dry fish alongside the grocery business. Grace wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders etc. to expand her business. Grace hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her provide the children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 45 years old and the mother of five children. Her children are currently in school.

To support her household, Georgina has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, onions and peppers at Okaishie market in the Greater Accra region. She says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N. sells cloths in Hohoe. Agnes did not receive any form of formal education.  She is married and has 4 dependants .Her husband is a trader whose earns a little for a living. Agnes has been selling cloths since 2005. She is responsible for feeding and clothing the children. Her loan will be used to buy ladies bags and shoes on large quantity and sell. She hopes to save the new profit from her business to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy ladies bags and shoes on large quantity and sell.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
ALCOM   LOS GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL

Doris Alejandrina G. Alegría D. 32 años, vive en el Sector Algodonal Los Olivos, tiene 2 hijos dependientes D. 3 y 6 años respectivamente.
La Sra. Doris se dedica ala venta D. F. hace 10 años y pertenece al grupo ALCOM – LOS GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL.
 Ella se inicia en este negocio ayudando a su mama lo hizo por que D. esta manera podía aportar algo para la economía D. su hogar ya que su esposo era el único que lo sustentaba, juntos han podido mejorar la construcción D. su casa con la compra D. materiales y también algunos artefactos para tener algunas comodidades, mas  adelante piensan terminar D. construir su casa y lograr q sus hijos sean profesionales D. éxito, con  el préstamo que le otorgara EDAPROSPO piensa realizar un viaje para visitar  a un familiar que llego del extranjero y conversar sobre su proyecto próximo D. adquirir un stand para la venta D. F., con lo cual asegurara su futuro y el D. su familia.


* Alcom Los Girasoles Del Algodonal el día D. su graduación,la señora Doris con pantalón rosado y casaca ploma.
texts.en:
Doris Alejandrina G. Alegría is 32 year old and lives in the district of Algodonal Los Olivos. She has two dependent children, ages 3 and 6 respectively. Sra. Doris has been selling flowers for 10 years and belongs to the group “Alcom – Los Girasoles del Algodonal”.

Sra. Doris started her business with the help of her mother so that she could start contributing toward the household expenses, since her husband was the only one supporting them at the time. She was able to purchase materials for home improvements and also household items to make her family more comfortable. Sra. Doris hopes to finish the construction projects around her house and that her children grow up to become successful professionals.

She will use her loan from EDAPROSPO to open a flower stand. The idea came to her while talking with a relative who was visiting from abroad and encouraged her to pursue this as her next business project. Sra. Doris believes this new venture will ensure her future and that of her family.

*The photo above was taken on graduation day for Los Girasoles del Algodonal. Sra. Doris is the woman on the right wearing pink pants and a white jacket.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a flower stand

loans.name: Diénabou Messin

texts.fr: Diénabou Messin Sané, 33 ans, divorcée, est mère de trois enfants dont elle a entièrement la charge. Elle est mebre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 6 ans. Elle a une bonne expérience en matière de petit commerce pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plus de dix ans. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Diénabou Messin Sané, age 33, is divorced and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 for six years. She has good experience regarding small-scale commerce for having practiced it for over ten years. The profits realized from her business enable her to support her offspring and to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business selling palm oil

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha, 28 years old, is married with three children. All three children are currently in school.

Isha is a trader who trades in rice. She has been retailing rice for the past three years. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country.

This, Isha believes, will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her to raise a good income to support her children in school. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Pino, es originario de la comarca San Pedro, perteneciente al Municipio de Ticuantepe, pero que queda aledaño a la zona de Nindiri, por lo cual es más factible para éste grupo viajar a Nindiri que a Managua. Está formado por cuatro integrantes que son: Doña Ana Julia V. M., Doña Paula Nelis L. H., Doña Edda del Carmen M. L. y Marvin de Jesús H. A..

Doña Ana es la mayor, tiene 44 años de edad, y es la coordinadora del grupo puesto que infunde confianza a los otros miembros, que aun que siendo jóvenes, abrazan mucha responsabilidad.

Ella trabaja en la elaboración de Tortillas de maíz en su comarca, oficio que aprendió hace tres años, gracias a su vecina que le enseño a hacerlas y le motivo a iniciar la venta de éstas, doña Ana se retó a iniciar el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como bodeguero en una empresa, pero cuyo  salario no les permitía brindar a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para salir adelante; 

Al ver que le iba bien decidió continuar y gracias al trabajo de ambos hoy su hija de 18 años está en la Universidad concretando su futuro y sus dos hijos menores tendrán la oportunidad de hacerlo de igual manera.

Doña Ana aspira poder vender otras variedades de productos ayudándose de los financiamientos recibidos, es por esto que el grupo flor de Pino, mantiene su excelente record crediticio.

Doña Paula es vendedora de ropa de todo tipo, según sea la demanda de sus clientes. Doña Edda es distribuidora de cosméticos de la línea AVON, y Marvin Distribuye pollo en diferentes zonas de su comarca.
texts.en:
The Group “Flor de Pino” (Pine Blossom) originates from the San Pedro region, which is part of the town of Ticuantepe and adjacent to the district of Nindiri. Because of their location, the group members find it relatively easy to travel from Nindiri to Managua. The four members of the group are as follows: Doña Ana Julia V. M., Doña Paula Nelis L. H., Doña Edda del Carmen M. L., and Marvin de Jesús H. A..

Doña Ana is the senior member of the group. She is 44 years old and the group coordinator. She instills confidence in the other members. Even though they are quite young, they embrace taking up much responsibility.

Doña Ana makes and sells corn tortillas in her neighborhood. She learned this skill three years ago thanks to a neighbor who taught her how to make them and motivated her to start selling them. She started her business with the help of her husband, who works for a company as a winemaker. His salary alone was not enough for them to provide the necessary conditions for their children to succeed.

Seeing that she had the support her husband, Doña Ana decided to continue her business. Thanks to both of their incomes, their 18 year old daughter is in college shaping her own future. Their two younger children will have the same opportunity to do likewise.

With the help of her loan, Doña Ana wants to begin selling a variety of other products. This is why she started the “Pino de Flor” group. The members have maintained an excellent credit record.

Doña Paula sells all types of clothing based on customer requests. Doña Edda is an Avon cosmetics distributor. Marvin sells chicken in different parts of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to increase their businesses

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary N. sells cloths in the central market, Hohoe. Rosemary has received junior high education.  She is married and has 7 dependants. Her husband is a trader whose income is small to cater for the large family. Rosemary has been selling cloths since 2001. She is responsible for feeding and paying of the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of the cloths and sell.  With the new profit from Rosemary’s expanded business she plans to save.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more of the cloths and sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is married and has 2 children. She did not receive any form of formal education. Charity sells smoke fish in Hohoe central market. Her husband is a trader. Charity uses her income in taking care of the children financial needs and in feeding the children. Charity will use the loan to purchase the fish on large quantity for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charity plans to invest into the business.

loans.use: Charity will use the loan to purchase the fish on large quantity for processing and sale.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna Y. est une femmme de 54 ans, elle marié et mère de huit (8) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis quatre ans et a une bonne expérience du crédit. Avec ses deux congélateurs verticaux elle développe une activité de vente de crême glacée, de jus de fruits naturels et de bouillie à base de céréales locaux. les bénéfices générés à partir de son activité lui permettent de payer la scolarité de certains de ses enfant et de contribuer à la nourriture et autres charges familiales.
texts.en:
Maïmouna Y. is a 54-year-old woman, married, and the mother of eight children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 for four years. She has good experience with loans. With her two upright freezers, she is developing a business selling ice cream, natural fruit juices, and porridge made from local grains. The profits generated from her business enable her to cover the cost of schooling some of her children and to help with food and other family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capacity to self-finance and to grow her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high. Her husband is a trader.

Agnes sells maize at the central market in Hohoe, which he has done since 1998. Agnes uses her income in providing food and clothes for the children.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase other staples like beans, millet and groundnuts (peanuts) to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase other staples to sell like beans, millet and groundnuts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. has received schooling through tertiary. She is married and has four dependents. She is responsible for paying utility bills and her dependents’ school fees.

Mary sells provisions such as canned fish, baked beans, and cooking oils as well as plasticware in the central market, Hohoe, which she has done since 1989. Her loan will be used to buy more of the plastic and aluminum products to sell. She hopes to save and build a house from the profits of her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more of the plastic and aluminum products to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El señor Rodolfo G. y su esposa la señora María Cristina Vargas, tienen tres hijos pequeños de edad, a los cuales les quieren dar lo mejor y que tengan un buen estudio.
En este momento tiene un problema que sus niños entran ha la escuela y el no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar las colegiaturas y comprar los uniformes que necesitan para que sus hijos no tengan ningún problema cuando entren a la escuela, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir está necesidad que se presento con los estudios de sus hijos.
Don Rodolfo tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, artículos de belleza, zapatos y variedad de cosa en diferentes partes de la ciudad, este es el ingreso que tiene para darle lo mejor a su familia y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo G. and his wife, Sra. María Cristina Vargas, have three young children. They want to give them the best and provide them with a good education.

At the moment, Sr. Rodolfo does not have the necessary funds to pay for his children’s tuition and uniforms in time for the beginning of the school year. He is requesting a loan to cover these costs so that his children can continue their education.

Don Rodolfo has a business selling clothing, beauty products, shoes, and a variety of other items in different parts of the city. He uses his earnings to provide the best for his family and will set aside a portion to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his children's tuition & school uniforms

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. sells Spices and seasoners at the central market, Hohoe. Lydia has received junior high education.  She is married and has 6 dependants. Lydia has been selling Spices and seasoners since 1998. She uses her income in helping the husband in footing the house keeping expenses.  With the increase in demand for Lydia’s Spice, her loan will be used to buy more of the spice for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: With the increase in demand for Lydia’s Spice, her loan will be used to buy more of the spice for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through senior high.

Stephen sells secondhand clothes in the central market of Hohoe, which he has done since 2004. He uses all his income solely to pay for the financial as well as the clothing needs of his children.

Stephen will use the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stephen plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: El Sufrido Group

texts.es:
Provenientes de la comarca El Raizon (Nindiri), ubicada en el Km 19 ½ de la carretera que nos lleva a Masaya, el grupo El sufrido está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que poseen la convicción de crecer y alcanzar sus sueños con forme al trabajo y ahínco que pongan a sus vidas.

Doña María Auxiliadora S. P., es la coordinadora del grupo, quien tiene 30 años de edad. de los cuales lleva ya tres años trabajando en la venta de cosméticos de diferentes marcas conocidas como los son Zermat y AVON.

Ella pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de comenticos, que distribuye al crédito a sus diferentes clientes, y luego de los abonos de estos, saca las cuotas que le corresponde dar. María inicio su negocio, cuando todavía trabajaba de Domestica en una casa, y parte de su salario lo invertía en su negocio para poder vender sus productos. 

Cuando conoció ADIM, contemplo la posibilidad de invertir su crédito en la  compra de sus productos y a partir de esto le ha ido muy bien, por lo cual pretende seguir adelante, hasta convertirse en una promotora de venta.

Teresa del Carmen C. C., quien trabaja en la elaboración de Nacatamales (Comida típica, hecha a base masa de maíz, carne de cerdo y algunas especias) que tiene mucha demanda por parte de los Nicaragüenses) y Claudia María S. L., quien posee un negocio de venta de Ropa Usada, son las otras dos integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
From the region of Raizon (Nindiri), located at Km 19½ of the road that leads to Masaya, there exists a group of three experienced women entrepreneurs who have the conviction to grow and achieve their dreams though hard work.

Doña María Auxiliadora S. P., the group coordinator, is 30 years old and sells various brands of cosmetics, including Avon and Zermat. She has been in business for 3 years. Doña María intends to use her loan to buy cosmetics, which see sells to her customers on credit. She will use the payments from her customers to satisfy her loan installments. She started her business when she was still working as a domestic employee and used part of her salary to purchase inventory. When she started working with ADIM, she contemplated buying more products. Since her business has done very well, she is seeking to advance herself to the level of sales promoter.

Other members:

Teresa del Carmen C. C. makes and sells nacatamales (a traditional dish made of corn-based dough, pork, and spices), which are very popular among Nicaraguans.

Claudia María S. L. operates a business selling used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and other merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. sells cosmetics and provision including toilet soaps, tissues assorted can soft drinks in Hohoe. Regina has received senior high education.  She is Divorced and has 2 children.  Being a single mother, she is responsible for her needs and that of the children. Her loan will be used to buy varieties of the provision and sell more of the cosmetics and provisions for resale. She hopes to save the new profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy varieties of the provision and sell more of the cosmetics and provisions for resale.

loans.name: Cephas

texts.en:
Cephas K. is a single parent with two children and has received senior high education. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his family as well as of himself.

Cephas sells provisions in Hohoe and his loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. He hopes to save the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience G. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high.

Patience sells a variety of provision in Hohoe, which she has done since 2004. She uses her income in helping her husband to pay the housekeeping expenses.

Patience will use the loan to purchase more of the provisions and other food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. sells provisions in Hohoe. She has received senior high education and is married and has three children. She is responsible in helping her husband to pay the housekeeping expenses.

Christine has been selling provisions since 2001. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions and food supplies for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food supplies to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet D. is married and has four dependents. She has received a basic form of education. Janet uses her income helping the husband in paying for the housekeeping expenses.

Janet sells grains such as maize and beans as well as yams in Hohoe central market, which she has done for twenty years. She will use the loan to purchase more of the food supplies including yams for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies, including yams, for resale

loans.name: Juana Cynthia

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. Tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.  Vive en el Barrio Huajsapata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de venta de coca (hoja de planta medicinal).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar coca, alcohol, incienso, velas, vinos, etc.

Su deseo es poner  una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Diana de Gales”, located in the District of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single, and does not have children. Sra. Juana completed her high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Huajsapata. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used as capital for her business selling coca (medicinal plant leaves). Sra. Juana is now requesting another loan in the amount of 1300 soles to purchase coca leaves, alcohol, incense, candles, wine, etc. She hopes to open a well-stocked grocery store. She enjoys the convenience of her payments and her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coca leaves, alcohol, incense, candles, wine, etc.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “21 D. Febrero”, en el distrito D. D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 6 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación primaria incompleta, vive en el Barrio D. Lacaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra D. abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa, ocas, quinua, etc. Estos productos D. la región los venD. en las ferias D. Ilave 

Su deseo es comprarse un carro y seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la forma D. trabajar.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurora is a member of the Communal Bank “21 D. Febrero” (February 21st), which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Sra. Aurora did not finish elementary school. She lives in the neighborhood of Lacaya. For the past 2 years, she has been working with Manuela Ramos. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase groceries. She is now requesting a loan of 700 soles to purchase potatoes, geese, quinoa, and other items. She plans to sell these regional products at the fairs in Illave. Sra. Aurora hopes to buy a car and keep working. She enjoys her savings and her line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, geese, quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Las Hijas Del Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Hijas del Rey, es originario de la Comarca Cofradía de la ciudad de Nindiri, está formado por doña  Karla Carolina M. H., Zenaida del Socorro O. J. y Elizabeth del Socorro P..

Doña Karla de 39 años, es la coordinadora del grupo, actualmente posee dos tipos de negocios que le están ayudando a salir adelante, uno es la venta de cosméticos y ropa por encargo, y el otro es la venta de comidas y bebidas en los cuadros de juego de  la comarca. 

Karla, trabajaba en un Kiosco de comida de un colegio, pero le facilitaron la oportunidad de adquirir un crédito y vender en los juegos de la liga de futbol. Así inicio la venta de comida y frescos y quiere invertir su crédito a este negocio principalmente ya que las ganancias la mira con mayor rapidez que con su otro negocio.

Su mayor sueño es poner su propia cominería, y no seguir vendiendo ambulante, aun que alega que le va muy bien en la venta ambulante así que no pretende dejarla.

Doña Zenaida trabaja en la elaboración de tortillas, tanto en la mañana como por la tarde y doña Elizabeth vende cosméticos y bisuterías; y esta iniciando el negocio de venta de carne y queso. Las tres afirman ser un grupo muy unido que se respaldan en situaciones difíciles, y por eso siguen siendo buenas clientas.

loans.use: Compra de Materia Prima para la venta de comed

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y madre de 02 hijos. Tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.  Vive en el Barrio Cesar Vallejo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de compra-venta de productos de la región.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papas, chuños, quinua, tuntas, además comprará carnes, queso, miel de abeja. Ella solo atiende pedidos, realiza sus compras en Tiquillaca, Atuncolla, y vende en Puno y Juliaca, también se dedica a su negocio de venta de joyas.

Su deseo es poder comprar un puesto para vender en el mercado de Puno.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos  y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Diana de Gales”, located in the District of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 2 children. Sra. Juana completed her high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Cesar Vallejo. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 9 years. Her first loan in the amount of 500 soles was used as capital for her business of buying and selling regional products. Sra. Juana is now requesting another loan of 3000 soles to buy potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, and dehydrated potatoes. She will also buy meat, cheese, and honey. Sra. Juana places her orders and purchases her merchandise in Tiquillaca and Atuncolla. She then sells her products in Puno and Juliaca. In addition, she operates a business selling jewelry. Sra. Juana hopes to buy a vending post at the Puno market. She enjoys the simplicity of her loans and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, potato flour, dehydrated potatoes, quinoa, meat, cheese, and honey

loans.name: Keny Flor

texts.es:
La señora Keny  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 01 hijo.  Ella estudió educación superior completa (nutrición), vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para se negocio de compra y venta de golosinas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará quesos, yogur, carne, etc. Todo lo compra en Azangaro, solo atiende pedidos semanales.

Su deseo es ser vendedora mayorista de quesos y yogur.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Keny is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She holds a degree in nutrition and lives in the neighborhood of Independencia. Sra. Keny has been working with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase candy for resale. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 400 soles to buy cheese, yogurt, meat, etc. She purchases her products in Azangaro and places her orders once a week. Sra. Keny hopes to be become a cheese and yogurt wholesaler. She enjoys the simplicity of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, yogurt, meat, etc.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 01 hijo, ella estudió educación primaria incompleta (3er grado).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir ganado menor (ovinos) para engorde.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando dice que ya se acostumbró.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos (ganado).

loans.name: Edruis

texts.es:
La señora Edruis es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos, ella estudió educación superior incompleta, vive en el Comunidad Casa Blanca.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a comprar ganado mayor (vacunos) para engorde.

Su deseo es comprar su casa en Arequipa y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Edruis is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 3 children. Sra. Edruis received some higher education, but did not complete a degree. She lives in the community of Casa Blanca. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost one year. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used to acquire sheep. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase cattle for fattening. She hopes to buy a house in Arequipa and educate her children. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle for fattening

loans.name: Hilaria Julia

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos, ella estudió educación secundaria completa, vive en el Comunidad Casa Blanca.
